v3ld0spZtWkPdZH9H6FggQ.text: Perfection location in the waterfront. Habachi grill is always good entertainment with the meal, or on a nice day to sit outside on the patio. Sushi has always been fresh, only complaint is their sushi rolls are to large.   Highly Recommened.

GUIZEw6XMwLDBNmRyW4m6A.text: This is my favorite Japanese steakhouse around by far.  This is the only place where I actually like there sushi.  The hibachi is fire too nothing like a good piece of steak or chicken with some super loud scallops.   A must try in my opinion is the mafia roll and some sugar snap peas, I dont know how they do it but those peas are so good it should be illegal.

CeT30nK5JQRmpQYP_X1wEg.text: The entire experience was pretty cool, until the next day I found that the waitress who was named "Summer" took the initiative to add an extra $6 tip onto what I had already left her. I will NEVER spend my hard earned money here ever again. If you eat there please be aware. I'm not too sure how often they do this to people, just make sure you pay attention to your receipts and your bank statements.

fYjwePpaz6OhagiNTn78yA.text: Our waitress was very sweet and checked up on us frequently. The sushi was good and the prices aren't bad! I'd go again

werGn3msUnfenx4xy3W31A.text: Food excellent depends who sits in your group can be distracting and make your dinner not pleasant!! Entertaining!!

photos.caption: Photo of Yokoso Japanese Steakhouse - Homestead, PA, United States. Mmm!!

MdGtnt53YLs07hPAbjHIAw.text: I have been here before and have had great experiences. On my most recent trip here, the server kept forgetting everything and she actually came out of the kitchen eating food. The manager knew who it was before we even told him her name. He also was not too interested in the information and kind of blew us off. Our chef was awesome and he was very comical.

pIu0rKkQ02SuVTc0jl3ilg.text: Food and hibachi chef were good....service was just okay, waitress wasn't friendly and I finally received a drink refill when I was almost finished with my meal.  Only the dinner menu was offered during lunch time on New Year's Eve so that was also really disappointing.. We got there slightly after 12 noon.....not really up for 5 courses, but wanted to take my sons for their bdays (they also wouldn't deduct the $15 they advertise on their menu as the Birthday special when purchasing 4 hibachi dinners). Because we had to order Hibachi dinners with 5 courses, rather than the Lunch Hibachi with 3 courses, we ended up with a super expensive lunch (over $125 with waitress tip - not counting the chef's tip), and had to leave leftovers in the car while we shopped at The Waterfront.  The Manager (older tall guy no uniform on) was talking to the hostesses and didn't acknowledge our party leaving....really rude considering we passed the hostess stand to exit and again because the "only dinner menu" rule meant hibachi for four was really expensive for lunch. Not very friendly overall between waitress, hostesses, manager (chef was good). Forcing customers at lunch time to order 5 course meals to pad their revenue is just wrong. Yes, we stayed willingly because it was both of my sons' birthdays, but with many other nice restaurants in Pittsburgh, doubt we will go back.

IQ5-z1uYcZ7EB_0nB_I6_g.text: The hibatchi food at this location is absolutely WONDERFUL. The chefs are a delight! My family and I go about once every two months or so and I've learned some things. There are a couple servers I will always avoid. But over all its a very great and pleasant place to eat. The only thing we ALL cringe at is that one of the managers is constantly yelling at someone. Whether a server bar tender host or hostess he is ALWAYS yelling and reprimanding in front of customers! These are paying guests (for now) that will most likely never come back.... They almost lost my service quite a few times.... I have seen the same manager sitting at the bar on his phone with a coat and winter hat on as well while the phone rang over and over and the hosts were busy seating people and doing what looked like helping servers deliver drinks etc...for the ENTIRE time I was there attempting to enjoy my meal in a booth with friends. He is just disrespectful to his employees and I'm not quite sure why he is even still a manager at all. He has made my server cry by yelling (and swearing) at her in front of us (and children). I have gone many times when an asian manager was there or a blonde young female recently. They seemed to be polite and helpful. Ive had enjoyable meals there those times. A few good servers and the great food are the ONLY reason we return. The atmosphere is not so pleasant when that certain manager Is there.

2KX8YQber4ZKwek2wzhQkg.text: Delicious!!!    On our Faves list!  PROS: Clean (Much more so than Sho-gun of Monroeville, due to being newer) Great Sushi Nice Staff Full Bar Area & Nice Atmosphere  CONS: a bit pricey VERY busy on weekends! The potential to get "stuck" sitting with an a-hole is possible due to the seating around the hibachi grills.  DINNER SUGGESTIONS: "Steak (Filet) & Shrimp Combo with Mushroom Appetizer" (you'll get the fried rice and veggies plus a nice amount of shirmp and beef, but you'll also get extra mushrooms on your plate which are delicious)  If you're looking for this type of food (Japanese Steakhouse/Hibachi), then Yokoso is a great choice.  Its not as trendy or conveniently located in Southside as Nakama--which we like, but Yokoso is a lot newer and cleaner than Sho-gun and its still very easy to get to (and park at) considering its just in the Homestead Waterfront.

OSf7O-DGMEDbOSyNe65nOg.text: Generally, this is a solid option for sushi/hibachi close to home. Customer service can be lacking though, depending on your sever. During my most recent visit, the server was very young and seemed eager to serve the food quickly (so our table could be cleared). When my friend asked for a recommendation on wine, the server replied several times that she had no knowledge of wine before my friend finally asked her to consult with a bartender. The sushi was delicious and the hibachi was fine, but seemed a little less flavorful than usual. I am not sure if this was due to the seasoning, or due to the fact that we weren't seated at a hibachi table where the meal was cooked in front of us. Despite that, every other member of the staff we interacted with (including the manager) was extremely friendly and helpful. Overall, it was a successful meal and this will still be a standard waterfront location for a convenient dinner.

gch_gieDQrhS3opsrtw6KA.text: Very tasty food, good service, _very_ good plum wine ... .  :)  All the folks we interacted with were quite pleasant. And the service was quick - though I acknowledge it could have just _seemed_ to be so, and I may've been distracted by the pleasant-ness of the company I kept.

0A8jiirZuXip_s6WAIaoTA.text: Good sushi variety, allows customizations, friendly staff... slightly noisy, but the booths give you enough privacy.

Z3ySj_FCeRpbhMc15dM0Rw.text: I had a particularly good experience but it could be because of the time of day.  We came here for a late lunch on a weekday so we got prompt service.  We ordered a steak and shrimp hibachi plate and 3 rolls (Dragon, New York, and Pittsburgh).  The hibachi plate was pretty good and came with the green onion soup.  It was priced reasonably for the quality and quantity.    The sushi was delicious too, but I don't have a discerning palate.  I'm a fan of the fast-food ish sushi places in Oakland by Pitt, which are cheaper, but I can't confidently tell you that Yokoso's rolls, because it costs a tad more, tastes better.  It's definitely got a better selection, though, than the sushi places by Pitt.  I'm not sure if that alone is enough to warrant a trip here (if we ignore the hibachi for a second).  Overall, the bill wasn't bad at all, especially considering we doggie bagged and got great service.  I have a feeling this place might be better for lunch than for dinner.  I have no idea what the live Hibachi experience at this place is like, though.

ybsumXmPnmVUo-BU_uESmQ.text: Great place! Awesome sushi and Japanese grill. Great food and service!  If you have a larger party, though, call ahead. And parking at the Waterfront is a nightmare sometimes, so I'd advise going early, parking and then enjoy the shopping, restaurants and bars in the area.

9mXk-64Pg3LFr_e6Kbrfyw.text: horrible service after waiting over an hour for my dinner the waitress served cold steak and chicken that must've sat out from hibachi grill with mushrooms (after specifically requesting no mushrooms due to allergic reaction) also ordered a sushi roll because it was "tsunami tuesday" that was made with cold tempura shrimp (tempura shrimp is normally deep fried). Requested managers and there solution to the problem was to make me wait another 30min for food to be remade and still charged me full price after refusing to remove the mushrooms. The managers also decided to charge me full price for an incorrectly made sushi roll (which fell apart in rice chunks) that should've have been half price because its was 50% off specialty sushi night. This ruined my evening dinner with my loved ones after a long day of work we will never eat here again. VERY POOR CUSTOMER SERVICE

bAmGJR6-kLc0ucjw-rDe5w.text: We tried to go to Smoke BBQ Taqueria however couldn't find a nearby ATM so opted to look for a place on the Waterfront. We landed at Yokoso and while we thought we would be going in for sushi we ended up deciding to go with hibachi, which ranged from about $16 to $30 depending on the types of meat/seafood you choose ($14 for vegetarian). Our waitress was nice though our hibachi chef was hilarious and very outgoing which made for a pleasant experience. If you do go, I would suggest asking for Colin. You can tell he really loves his job and has been hibachi-ing for 11 years now or so he says. Food was allright though the sauces certainly helped,and the big portions helped with the prices.I do like how they seat you family style.

GwGMvyUiwN7_xZFDDf-TuA.text: Fabulous dining experience. My first time eating sushi and was very impressed and thrilled to have such a great experience.  We order 6 different rolls to try a little bit of everything and it was a great.

C-rSuPlTbWH07QWCdL-HYQ.text: Yokoso is a good hibachi and sushi spot that is located in a convenient part of the city (i.e. the Waterfront) and is also--thank goodness--surrounded by available parking.  I have been there during both lunch and dinner--weekdays and weekends--and have sampled the hibachi and sushi.  And for the most part, the food is very good.  The restaurant recently revamped its menu and I've noticed an overall slight price increase.  More noticeable are the changes to their sushi menu, where some rolls have been removed and shifted while new, inventive rolls take their place.  Sushi selections are pictured in a large, colorful menu that shows pictures along with detailed ingredients for each roll.  And while this is extremely helpful for visual individuals, I still find it slightly overwhelming having to scan over twenty different roll varieties.  However, the new additions sound tasty, with both the Yum Yum and Lobster Cali Rolls being two of my favorites thus far.  Thus far, I have experienced good, quality service whenever I've decided to stop by for a quick bite or to place an order to go.  The wait staff is engaging and friendly and I have never had any delays with my food.

lM9UkKLdAvfEYmzk2yu1aQ.text: I was a little nervous after reading some of the reviews but it was a really nice experience and the food was very good! Our server Bryn was right on que with everything....EXCELLENT service! Our chef...and I am sorry I forgot his name he was great also..in fact as I looked around, everyone who worked there seemed on there game...managers were out and looking around, servers were moving quickly to get orders and refills...lively place with the drums banging and servers singing for birthdays...I even found myself clapping with them. And larger portions than other habachi places...we will definitely be back!

EIj-aqVHKUunMrvbQNLdWQ.text: Frequent this place due to the friendly service and excellent food.  Thx to all the gals for making us feel so welcome!  Highly recommend !

B8OuuZtfLEBVL1kvG-Iq2g.text: This used to be one of my favorite hibachi places when I lived in Pittsburgh.  It's still a great place to visit.  We went for lunch, so it wasn't too busy.  I ordered the chicken & shrimp hibachi.  DH got salmon and chick hibachi.  They gave us a massive amount of food! Enough that my daughter had a full plate and we hadn't even ordered for her.  The hibachi show was ok.  There wasn't much of a show.  Mostly knife tricks, volcano fire, and that was pretty much it.  I figured it was probably because it's lunch time.  I remember the dinner shows are pretty amazing.  I also ordered two pieces of Inari which were delicious! The food was good and seasoned well. Definitely, a place to check out if you are in the Waterfront area.

AAMCtG5X0K4BIXsHjnvOZw.text: Best hibachi in Pittsburgh! I've had multiple birthday parties here and so has my sister! The hibachi is beyond amazing and they put on a decent show. They also make the best fried rice. And the sauces are so good. I'm not really a fan of the salad or the soup they serve before hand but that doesn't matter because there is so much food that comes with the order. And they are very accommodating about birthdays so if you bring an ice cream cake or a cake and ice cream they will put it in their freezer for you until you are ready for it. Overall, I have probably been there 30 times and am going again tonight and I have never had a negative experience.

e3jhTdagMNDFsT_mWaOkPQ.text: Sushi was great. Service was great, but the $38 Yokoso imperial diner was blah. Not worth the  money the $38 for a shrimp, lobster,  and steak dish that is something like you can get at any take out place. Also our bill added up quick $$$! Although the whole glass of sake for $8 was a bargain for a wine sized glass!

3H8CHQqoMliLGGqN6MT-IA.text: Nope. Never again. Slow service, huge prices, and mediocre food. Tonight, I ordered shrimp and chicken and my shrimp was underdone. The gyoza was hard fried and the appetizers and entree came out at the same time. My husband's sushi came out 20 minutes after my meal. The manager gave us an $8 discount on my very bad meal. The miso soup was lukewarm and tasteless. The manager didn't even have the decency to stop by our table to apologize for the bad meal. Just say no. There are better places for Japanese than here.

qN03R5W6WTnQf2pXynOEeA.text: My bf took me here for birthday dinner, and the fire tricks were pretty awesome. The food portion was huuuuuuuuge, so be aware.  O they've got pretty tasty drinks as well :3 Their sushi is a must try :p

J9MhrGjSno-yZ9tjkUijQQ.text: Bartenders were rude - walked passed us several times without once greeting us. Took 7 to 10 minutes before we were even greeted. They were not busy or taking other people's orders just doing some busy work like wiping down glassware.   Once we actually received service the bartender was talking to the lady next to us about some strange story. We waited to order... Again   Bad attitudes all around ... The bartender said several times to the hostess make sure you avoid putting in Togo orders.. No one there wanted to do their job. Food was mediocre... Service was rancid...   Will not go back ..

t9RHavk7uqdD5em1-7siQA.text: I've been here a few times for lunch and it's always been okay, not terrible, but not fantastic.   I was here last weekend for lunch and sat at the bar. We started with a sushi roll to share, we got the Pirate Roll. It was panko-breaded and deep-fried, with salmon, cream cheese, and asparagus inside and topped with an eel sauce and spicy crab salad. I didn't care for the eel sauce (Justin liked it, though!), but the roll itself was delicious. We ordered two meals from the Hibachi Lunch Menu, I got the NY Strip Steak and Chicken and Justin got the NY Strip Steak and Shrimp. They both came with soup or salad to start and also hibachi vegetables and fried rice. The portions were very healthy for lunch. The fried rice was delicious and so, so much better than the last time I was there. The rest of the meal was good, too. The steaks were well cooked and seasoned, but my chicken was slightly dry.   I've only ever been here for lunch, and don't know that this is a place I would even come for dinner. The price point goes up significantly, and while the food is good, I worry I would be disappointed with a dinner service. It's never too busy when I'm there for lunch, so I'm not too sure what the atmosphere is like in the evening. The service I've received here hasn't been BAD per say, but it hasn't been great. The staff is always very nice, but aren't necessarily the most efficient. It just seems like everyone is a little sluggish or apathetic.   So, all in all, if you are looking for a decent lunch while at the Waterfront, this is a good option. If you work at the Waterfront, they offer a Waterfront discount, you just have to ask. I don't really know the stipulations, but maybe bring a pay stub or something just in case! They also offer half price sushi rolls on Tuesdays, which is a fantastic deal.

photos.caption: Photo of Yokoso Japanese Steakhouse - Homestead, PA, United States. Pirate Roll.

-IlMSMYfoHq1sqAI3uJyGw.text: Never had the hibachi here, just sushi. Decent sushi and selection. A lot of specialty rolls that cater to the Pitt Panthers, Polamalu, Pirate and Steel City rolls. It's a little over priced, but most places in the Waterfront are just  a bit. They do run specials during the week of half off special rolls which is a deal.  The staff is friendly and accommodating.  It's not the best sushi in Pittsburgh, but it does the trick. Alcohol Selections are pretty good with a seasonal on tap. Not sure on happy hour prices.

photos.caption: Photo of Yokoso Japanese Steakhouse - Homestead, PA, United States. Sushi bar

XWOoYp6RSn019fC0a-VDYw.text: Short version:  We got up and left after sitting at the table for 40 minutes without any sign of the hibachi chef and numerous excuses by the apathetic staff of why they were backed up.  Long version: The place is an example of how not to operate a restaurant.  We stopped in for dinner on a weeknight, and the place did not seem busy at all.   When we asked for hibachi for 2 people, they said it would be a 30 minute wait.   We were in no rush so we agreed and they told us they would send us a text when we could be seated.  Fast forward 30 minutes, the text never arrived so we returned to the restaurant.  They said they were having issues with their notifications system and they could seat us.   Okay fine no big deal.    We get seated at the hibachi table along with some other parties.   A waitress comes over and takes our drink and food orders.  We get our drinks and about 20 minutes passes.   The waitress re-appears and tell us they are out of soup and brings us our salads.   We wait another 20 minutes.     While we were waiting, one of the other guests accidentally spills her drink on the hibachi grill top in plain sight of the waitress.   She does not clean it up and does not ask anyone else on the staff to clean it up either.  Finally after 40 minutes of waiting at the table, we decide to cut our losses and go across the street to another restaurant.

zkfZTgdquR1_92y0ppl_1g.text: I haven't eaten here for quite a while, mostly because I always forget about it when I'm hungry for sushi.. A couple days ago we stopped for a quick bite. We sat in a front booth since we were not ordering hibachi. The hundreds of diners who have sat at these booths have destroyed the padding making them uncomfortable. In addition, the diner with her back to me pushed back against my side of the booth over and over again. We ordered the tempura sampler platter which was well fried without any greasy taste. However, the spring rolls tasted mushy and the shrimp shumai did not have much flavor. We also ordered the Spicy California Rolls and the Japanese Mafia #2. Both choices were freshly made as we watched and quite tasty.

oPCmc2UN_4KgX77Lzf1MJQ.text: Went for my first Tsunami Tuesday sushi got the yokoso roll and steak hibachi. Very good minus the one long blond hair in my food. Apparel and professionalism very poor. For the Yoga pants and hoop earrings? Horrible in my eyes. Very tacky. Eatn park has uniforms. ? Hmm.. Needless to say the sushi is good no hair in that

X_wBn858ZB1XzS2vZCMU7g.text: We walked in for lunch(Sunday 10/02/16 12:15), we requested a high top table in the bar area, the hostess behind the counter handed us two menus and pointed to the available tables, she had more interest in her phone than to walk us and our menus to the table to seat us.  The bartender/server did an outstanding job as her tip reflected. The food was excellent and the portions where huge, sashimi.  On our way out the male manager and "cell phone " hostess looked us in the eyes and did not say one word as we exited. I definitely believe great customer service makes a restaurant a whole, if the staff was more friendly (excluding our bartender/sever she was awesome and friendly) I would have rated this restaurant 5 stars.  If I were the manager, I would have all employees place their phones in a lockbox unless on break or finished their shift for the day. The hostess played on her phone 95% of the time while we ate lunch.

ChrGjamTUyZ9mTo2HJldgQ.text: I've eaten here a few times, usually for chicken and shrimp teriyaki off the hibachi but this particular Tuesday I came on a solo mission for half off specialty sushi and I've never been more pleased.  I started with the Spider Roll, a combination of of course rice and a seaweed wrap that has soft shell crab tempura, avocado, crab and cucumber add in a little wasabi sauce and eel sauce and you got yourself a combination you never want to stop coming.  So much so I was gonna venture off but stayed with this for 3 orders.  15 pieces of sushi and $20 later I couldn't be any happier.  The rolls came quick,the bartender served them with a smile and the price well, the price was worth every hard earned cent.  For the health conscious keep in mind what I ate was a total of 1000 calories and it surely will keep me full long through the evening.  The drinks are a little expensive but that's the price you pay for convenience at any restaurant.  They are always generously made and the beer is always cold.  The staff always welcomes me with open arms and throws in any extras you may need without a grunt like pickled ginger, wasabi, lemons and sauces.    I've been here before and now that I know about this day of the week I'll be coming back a bit more often but next time, with lots of people!

SOzOU8A4247-gD5HOJfK7g.text: We've been here several times, it's convenient to the movie theater.  Here's what I love:  Plum wine and Squid Salad - never anything but fantastic.  Here's what is A-ok:  The sushi rolls.  Nothing unique, but consistently ok.  Also the atmosphere.  It's a pleasant chain.  Here's the wild card:  Service.  It's either fantastic or terrible.  Starting with the hostess...  who may be warm and friendly or chatting with coworkers or just really, REALLY bored with the whole being-at-work situation.  Will we keep going there?  Yes... we are movie goers and the Squid Salad is quite good.  If Yokoso were in an independent location though...

xgyqUyMDYz_MncpwcQFX_g.text: I dont even know where to start with this place!  I have been eating here every Tuesday for the last year and a half and have never left less than completely satisfied!  The sushi is honestly the best I have ever tried. Depending on the chef, sometimes the sizes and looks vary, but it is ALWAYS delicious.  The hibachi, the fried rice, the sushi, its all delicious! It can be a little pricey if you dont come for 1/2 price tuesdays or for lunch, but its worth it!  I recommend it to every one I know and I try to bring new people with me to convert them in to Sushi Tuesday lovers!

G4BG8WvX_s_7pN7SoDf8Fw.text: Tonight was our first time here and all I can say is our service was outstanding!!!!!! Our cook was Colin who has been in the business for years. I've been to many hibachi restaurants and have never met a cook with such heart and soul. He prepared our food beautifully, it was absolutely delicious. Also our waitress was Alyssa, she was a delight and very attentive to us unlike a lot of servers who you see once to take your order and give you your check at the end of your meal. Needless to say we will be coming back to see them and highly recommend requesting them when you go to visit!

OoKd9O1qEMeFc4GDEBrsyQ.text: Wonderful experience me and my friends went here for lunch today. The service was great and the food was amazing !!! Also the chef was a great guy!

j704k00D7CFLZtnerT2vYw.text: Sushi was great! Laurn L the server was beautiful and great. But the only bad part was if you want the happy hour specials you had to sit at the bar. Most places it doesn't matter. Everything else was great. Change the the happy hour rule.

OTqhLi-nTcICxLL9iGA33w.text: To start off, I came to this place hearing some pretty good reviews from friends. Getting here was simple, parking was easy and the wait staff was courteous and swift. Our waitress asked for drink orders and I asked for a vodka tonic, not an unreasonable request. After the entire party was served, except for myself, she comes back to the table and asks if I just want a shot of vodka or it mixed with water. I told her, again, I would like a vodka tonic with a slice of lime. She goes to the bar and comes back with a glass of vodka with a splash of water, and a lemon. I asked her if she had any tonic water and she said yes but the machine must be replaced, so she brings me a second glass, the same way, this time with no garnish. By this point I am livid but keep my mouth shut and enjoy the company of my friends. My dinner finally arrives and I have chewy burnt scallops with burnt shrimp. When I say this place would be my last choice of hibachi, it would be a lie. I would NEVER come back to this place EVER EVER EVER. Worst most horrible hibachi experience of my entire existence!!!!

PfbT7smzP8F99ZZGcypmFQ.text: Great for a quick bite sitting at the sushi bar for some rolls.  Friday nights are hopping being near the theaters. Music included arrested Development and breakfast at tiffanys.  Decent selection of saki to get over that.  I like the pictorial menu of rolls!  Less expensive places for sushi,  but the quality overall is better than most,  at least for the rolls.  Servers seem a bit overextended.  Would be great for a casual date,  although I'm married,  just saying we like it here. My husband said I should mention the rolls are so big,  it was hard for me to fit them into my pie hole.

q8suAVYKrIM2kSbkfNwdNA.text: My wife and I love this place! Good food and always have a good time. Would definitely recommend this to everyone. Don't forget to tip your chef!

ezoBo-GzEqduTHKYfPrHzQ.text: Yokoso has gone a little down hill over the years. It's an okay place for hibachi, but no great. Their California rolls are pretty good. It's nice if you're looking for sushi to go, just call ahead.

photos.caption: Photo of Yokoso Japanese Steakhouse - Homestead, PA, United States. California rolls

qzPIgPqGcnDFs0z0BDgZ1Q.text: My most recent visit to this place pushed it up a notch...but still probably only a 2.5.  Here's the scoop:   The good:  - The location in the waterfront is convenient.  I can get some errands done and run over for some sushi.    - Sushi Tsunami Tuesdays - 1/2 price on rolls - The picture-filled sushi menu.  They have the specialty rolls listed in the regular menu, but if you need a more complete description, they have a picture version that you can use to better visualize what you are getting.  - The sushi.  The rolls are a tad rice-heavy for me; but other than that, I am always happy with what I order.    The bad:   - The service.  With the exception of this last visit, the service is generally very poor.  Slow, inattentive, etc. - you always get the impression that they resent being there to wait on people.   - The prices are a tad on high side for what you get.    - The general practice of asking whether you want the wasabi/ginger dish.  This is really only annoying because the service is generally poor.  Half the time they forget to ask (and the average person wouldn't know that it doesn't come automatically.  And if they do remember to ask, they then forget to bring it.  All in all, I still go there (mostly on Tuesdays for 1/2 priced sushi), but I do get annoyed by the service when I do.

e591Cc-2ECIrkynWnlt1eg.text: The past two times I've gone here I got sick afterwards. This last visit was terrible. We had made reservations get there a few minutes early. We were taken to a table and then told it would be 45 min due to the other guests there request a certain cook. We told the wait staff that we didn't want to wait that long that's why we made reservations. They seated us at another table only to make us move again. The food was under cooked, the rice was still hard and the veggies were not fully done. The cook was very nice, that's the only positive I have for this last visit.

GeBgu4XVLneHfLwkvCxRcg.text: I'm actually pretty surprised that this place has been open for so long in the Waterfront. It's not terrible but it should certainly be a lot better considering the price. I had the shrimp/steak hibachi and it was alright. The sauces were bland and the cook didn't prepare my steak correctly. The cook was great other than that. My waitress was pretty awful. The first thing I asked was 'do you have any drinks with banana?' and she told me they did not. However, the first drink on the menu has banana in it so that's a good example of how our service went. I just don't think this place is worth it for the price. There's an excellent hibachi place at Monroeville Mall if you're really interested in trying some hibachi around Pittsburgh.

KMvmWcOSw0hAh1grv_cOmg.text: This is the only Japanese restaurant that I've been to that serves deep fried sushi. I like the idea and it is delicious. It is very filling but it was very flavorful. I have always had great, quick service and the food has been good. If its your birthday, they have a great birthday song!

gu6ylZhGsRzujfdwkhEnFw.text: I've had a few good sushi meals here until yesterday. I ordered a bunch of sushi and sashimi. I actually watched the sushi chef, as I sat at the bar, put scrap pieces of salmon from a plastic container in my roll. I thought, I hope that's better than it looks. I should have rejected it but instead I tried it. It was indeed old scrap, fishy tasting salmon. I'm still burping it now at 6:00am. Nasty!! Although the manager was helpful and tried by reducing my bill, I'm burping old fishy salmon flavor still, not what I wanted from a descent sushi dinner. I doubt I'll be going back. That Sushi chef should be fired!! You NEVER serve someone scrap, bad fish!!

0rZtEdKQFRqtoEuSCKu1Sg.text: OK Japanese restaurant.  Pricey, could use lunch specials.  Had questions about menu and server could not answer and did not get the answer.  House dressing was grainy and watery.  Sushi roll was fresh.  Shrimp Tempura small and greasy. Service was fast.

PdOnOhgJk1Dmqu-B6LZ6Fw.text: This is probably the worst Hibachi Shrimp and rice I have ever had. I ordered from a table vs. them cooking in front of me. I seriously think everything may have been frozen and nuked in a microwave. The shrimp was super tiny and the rice was mushy w/ no flavor. The Yum Yum sauce was bland too.

BaPXIZUpk63UFFYjKaj8iw.text: Before i start my rant; Yokoso has great tasting sushi. I'll never stop going there for their sushi. But this happened and i was extremely displeased; my girlfriend made reservations for my birthday on Decemeber 21st and very specifically told them it was my birthday. They told her we would get 15 dollars off the check, they'd sing to me, and a free dessert would be provided. We sit down with our friends at the Hibachi table with a few of my friends and my girlfriend reminds the waitress that it's my birthday. The waitress forgot just about everything imaginable while serving. Then the hibachi chef came out and she didn't say a word the entire time. The hibachi chef only did the flaming onion trick. The hibachi chef gave three teenagers at the table that we didn't know more rice and veggies than any of us at the other corner; so our food portions were extremely small. Finally the waitress brings out the checks and bids us a good night. I call the manager over to advise him that it's my birthday and we were told we would be sang to, get 15 dollars off the check, and be provided a free dessert. The manager says: "They probably forgot". They probably forgot? The reservations were made with the notice that it was for a birthday party. Anyway, he corrected the check and overall it was a horrible horrible experience at Yokoso. And that hibachi chef should really find a new profession because her performance was unacceptable.

FOrdJWYNIKyFBnO3zAiV4Q.text: Yokoso was always a big hit in my family... reasonably priced hibachi food, abundant seating, convenient location.  So when a relative of mine was in town for the week and asked where we could get a group together to meet for dinner, I tossed Yokoso out there.  I talked it up: the portion sizes, the flavors, the shrimp sauce.  Now, mind you, at this point its probably been 2 years since I was last there, but how much could a restaurant really change in that time?  Answer: a lot.  Our party of 7 was seated at one of the back hibachi tables which was nice, they are a little more private than the tables in the middle of the restaurant and this made it easy to converse.  I didn't catch the name of our chef but he was a nice young gentleman who we made easy conversation with upon discovering that all of us were originally from the immediate area (Munhall, Baldwin, West Mifflin).  Our group ordered a variety of hibachi dinners, ranging from steak to salmon to chicken.   I'm not sure about the rest of my group, as I was too afraid to ask after recommending this place so highly, but my meal was flavorless.  Normally a healthy dip in shrimp sauce would salvage the various parts of my meal, but even THAT was flavorless.  My steak was a bit overcooked (I asked for medium, it was bordering medium well/well done), the rice was bland, and the veggies, though cooked perfectly, were plain, sauteed veggies.  In order to not tip off my dining companions I simply stated I was already full from picking at my meal as it was prepared (easy to do at a hibachi place, am I right?) and opted to take practically my entire meal home. Even my SO was disappointed upon heating the leftovers up later that night.  Maybe our group's conversation sidetracked the chef and he forgot to season our food properly, or maybe the quality of this place has really gone downhill since I was last there.  Whatever it was, I left still hungry and disappointed.  I know this place is locally owned and not part of a giant hibachi conglomerate, but it's hard to eat local when there's such a lack of flavor.  Three stars because its clean, has TONS of seating, and the waiter and chef were both extremely nice.

MRO6Cwr7T_cL9QPgH0PHpg.text: We came here today because we had some shopping to do at the waterfront. We normally get sushi at various other places but wanted to try and do everything in one area.   Nice place, very good miso soup. But the sushi just wasn't good. It wasn't well constructed it kept falling apart, no wasabi or ginger was included (not a big deal), but overall not a great taste. And I've never had sushi I didn't really like.   It is what it is, but probably won't be back.

09My-taqc8dqouWWZozVwA.text: Terrible! My first and last visit here ever.   Let's start with the fact that it was my friend's birthday. It was my husband and me, my bff and her husband. Our main plan for the evening was to head to Sing-Sing. Due to getting a late start, we decided to stop here for dinner. It was Saturday night after 8pm so not very busy. We were seated outside quickly. Then we waited. And waited. A waitress passed our table 4 or 5 times without a word.  After at least five minutes, the hostess came outside and said that our waiter would be with us shortly, but she could get our drinks. It took her several minutes to bring out all of the drinks, since she didn't bring them all out together. And I still had to ask for my drink, because she forgot. There is some type of "birthday special" which inclues $15 off of a dinner, free cake, and some type of "sparker" and "popper" celebration. And a free gift...."while supplies last", whatever that means. This is good one week prior or after your actual birthday....pending valid ID. Although the menu also says not valid on Saturdays or holidays, my friend inquires anyways, since it is not at all busy. The hostess says that they will honor the birthday special and that the manager "is really cool and will be fine with it". Fine.   Waiter Joe finally arrives....dude is clueless. My friend's husband and I get hibachi dinners and my husband and friend get sushi platters. He asks what type of salad dressing we want....ginger or vinegar and oil. All four of us say vinegar and oil, all four come out with ginger. We have to ask the waiter several times for obvious things - Silverware and Napkins, More Drinks, To Take Plates Off Of The Table. You know, things that should come as common knowledge to wait staff.  When our meals come, he brings out one plate of sushi and seems confused, stating that they put all of the sushi on one plate.....uh no. We tell him there should be two plates. I mean, two people ordered two separate meals?! He fixes it and returns. Has no idea whose order goes to who....ugh.   At the end of the meal, Joe messes up our checks, putting things my friends ordered on our check. Again, we have to wait for this to get fixed. The worst part is that they automatically put 20% gratuity on the bill. I would not have left this dude a dollar if I had the choice. We waited several minutes to get our change. I actually had to go up to the bar and ask a bartender to find my waiter. Joe obviously cannot count either, he gave us $1.50 too much in change. I figured it could come out of his tip....  Here's the kicker....my friend gets none of this "birthday special"...no free cake, no $15 off, nothing. We inquire with Joe, who is still clueless. He has the manager, Jay, come out. My friend explains that, yes, we understand that it is Saturday, however the hostess said that it would be fine. Jay blabbers something about it being Saturday, and they try to exclude Saturdays to drum up business other, less busy days. We state, they are not busy at the moment. And this free cake thing means apparently, according to the manager, that if you bring your own cake, they won't charge you to plate it. His explanation for the ambiguous script on the menu? "The Japanese can't explain things well". Oh, okay.   He also says that the birthday special requires four meals to be purchased. Well, there is four of us, we say. He says, no....since they were on separate checks. Jay also says that this is "up the manager's discretion", but still will not give her the discount.  My friend says, "Okay that's fine. We just won't be returning". the manager's response is...."Have a nice night" and Walks Away!   I cannot even comment on the food....which was fine - not great not terrible - because there were so many other things to distract from the experience. This should have been a nice relaxing dinner with friends and it was blah blah blah.   I won't speak for the others (although I know their thoughts), but I feel cheated. One of the worst experiences at a restaurant ever. Will. Never. Ever. Ever. Return. You suck Yokoso!

photos.caption: Photo of Yokoso Japanese Steakhouse - Homestead, PA, United States. Shrimp hibachi
Photo of Yokoso Japanese Steakhouse - Homestead, PA, United States. Sushi

D0boGRIEmi0j0TwoZjT7og.text: Honestly, the worst service and hibachi I have ever had. And I am never one to actually complain about anything at a restaurant. The service was unprofessional and almost nonexistent. And the tables were covered in sauce. We waited 15 minutes to even see our server. When we finally got our food, it was barely warm and completely flavorless. Very disappointed when expecting a nice dinner and then overpaid for food we barely ate. The only thing I will recommend is the sushi. The three rivers roll was perfect.

pE8SFE2sdn0L_CgtZpu8yA.text: Food was ok.  Similar to most of the other Japanese  steak house eateries in Pittsburgh.  What I found odd and a little disturbing was the man who cooked our dinner.  When he asked if we had eaten there before we said no.  He told us it was similar to the others "except we have more white people cooking".  I let that pass.  Then he made a smiley face with oil and then smeared the eyes and said "this is a Japanese smiley face".  Really? Is this what we need right now!

hb7Whu12DOeIpyZ5d6zyTw.text: Walked in at 9:18pm tonight (Sun) and the guy at the door said, sorry we close at 9:30. Meanwhile the door and online says 10:00 and it's not even close to 9:30. Lots of people still in there too.   You won't get my business again, no matter what day or time it is.

E4DmMCfCdaniVecAc_oBqw.text: Terrible service. My sushi came out before my sons hibachi meal. We waited 35 mins before I asked another server (ours was no where to be found) if he could ask our server to refill our drinks. He asked, but 10 mins went by with no refills and still not having my sons meal. After all that time, we left before he ever got to eat and my meal was comped. With all these terrible ratings, why haven't they improved? Maybe they don't have yelp lol

CYJpDvXY0nAeX5b1lVy69g.text: Always walked by this place every time I was in the Waterfront and never actually went in. For the hell of it, I went in and it was one of the best food decisions I've ever made. The sashimi is fresh, and finely cut. The sushi rolls themselves are immaculately made and they are very generously in the size of the rolls. Easily one of the best sushi spots I've ever been to, even including my trips to NYC. Great spot, great atmosphere, great food.

photos.caption: Photo of Yokoso Japanese Steakhouse - Homestead, PA, United States

7Oh8VTiO2Bn_E8RfNLAR3Q.text: Truly the worst sushi in the city. The edamame was also undercooked and tasteless and the dragon roll was also tasteless, despite all the sauces the put all over it to help give the sad eel they served some flavor. Maybe their BBQ is better. For the sushi - just say no.

SvB7PdtMR9X82nASg6vJJw.text: If you are at the Waterfront and craving sushi, this is the place for you!  The sushi is made fresh. You can sit at the sushi bar to eat or at a table. They have a lot to choose from. They even have pictures of everything so you see what you are getting. My two favorites are the Three Rivers Roll and the Polumalu roll.  They also have hibachi here. You can sit at one of the big tables or order it from your table at the sushi area. Sometimes we order both and share. I dislike how loud the hibachi tables get and I wish there was more separation from the sushi area for the nights you just want a quiet dinner.

NdMn1ChdVf-KO7MtUKH0HQ.text: Food is good, but service is poor. Be very cautious about price. I pointed to the dish that was on the menu, but not priced. I ended up paying 46$ with average menu price 15$. Bad guaranteed if you make same mistake.

EEnbXicvkEWv-zEzdAeA4g.text: Awful service before you even sit down at your table!  Here was my experience: I called for reservations a few hours ahead of time to have lunch on a Sunday afternoon with a small group of friends.  My interaction with the gentleman (if you can call him that!!) was already a preview to our bad experience.  He was rude - he never said hello or goodbye - literally hanging up the phone without saying anything and curtly took my information for the reservation.  Then when we showed up the greeters had NO CLUE what was going on. Keep in mind that the place was half empty.  5 out of 6 of our party was waiting in the lobby.  They asked that we wait for our whole group before being seated.  I get it - when restaurants are busy they don't want to waste time if a group is not complete.  But the place was empty!!!  Then, we asked if we could be seated and we would gladly start our lunch at a normal pace and our friend could just catch up - we shared we weren't even sure she was ordering a meal.  The manager (yes, MANAGER) curtly said that once we sit the "clock starts".  I'm sorry - but my Sunday afternoon lunch should NOT BE TIMED BY A STOPWATCH.   They absolutely refused to seat us.  They even went so far as to say that if we did choose to sit, even in the bar area (read: non-hibachi) our friend could join us but she would be NOT be able to order from the menu.  Needless to say, we immediately informed them that we would be leaving to have lunch elsewhere.

l7v2PTwDWu7f9q2w6tzmzg.text: We went here for my friends birthday. While our chef was entertaining, the food wasn't too impressive and the service was not good. They said they would sing happy birthday and never did. The hostesses and the waitress ignored our reminders. We were disappointed and I probably will not go again. If I want hibachi I will pay the extra money for nakama.

SI2BnJqoy8AM5TUxEoBhbg.text: Food was mediocre, at best. Service was AWFUL.  We were lured in by the smell, but the food did not live up to it.  Not even in the same ballpark as Ichiban.

U0YVs2WlqiZ1iuA0qWdGYA.text: The food was decent but very bland and dry. The chef put on a really great show but I will most likely not be returning. Take my advise and go to Ichiban instead. You won't be sorry

xIhTVwyZgKLbt3epBvoiSA.text: This cute little spot nestled at the waterfront was just what I needed after driving 4hrs to Pittsburgh to see my boyfriend. The rolls were quite tasty and for a pretty good price. The Caterpillar Roll was my favorite with its jumbo avocado slices wrapper around the roll. Delish! The blackberry sake was not very good, but then again, I am not a fan of sake....decided to try it.  I wish i hadn't. Great hostesses & romantic ambiance. I will definitely return to Yokoso when I head back up north to Pitt! :)

photos.caption: Photo of Yokoso Japanese Steakhouse - Homestead, PA, United States. Yokoso Roll, Pittsburgh Roll, Caterpillar Roll, Paradise Roll

Gzgxu9P24yAg4cKQT4E1bA.text: Um, no thank you.  I mean, I get that this place caters to big groups/bday parties and drunk people (True story) in the spirit of Benihana, but the hootin' and hollerin' coupled with bad service was too much for us. Since it was just the 2 of us, it seemed we werent as important as the bachelorette party next door. Pat ordered a Kirin that never came and the salmon dinner for two consisted of two sad slabs of pre-frozen salmon and cheap fried rice--the kind that has peas, corn and carrot squares in it. We left sans beer and ended up stopping at Chaya in Squirrel Hill in order to erase the awful memory of our dining experience.

uJri5i4ue6Vr77JH1FmPjg.text: Took my 10 year old son there for his birthday. It was awesome, chin our chief was great. Food was really really good , you get a ton of food . Would go there again

amvqdRI5pFJSVxzpOhNdIw.text: So we requested our cook to be Cliff... We got someone else. He was very cool and funny but he overcooked most of the food. I think he got caught up in entertaining us that he didn't realize we were hungry and that the food was already done. I ordered a chicken and teriyaki salmon entree. It was seasoned well but dry because he let it cook too long smh. I probably won't go back unless it's for a birthday because they sing a song, play a drum and throw confetti! I would recommend Saga in Robinson or if you go ask for Cliff because he is one of the best cooks there

LiLlZTy4DtebzbES67YWkg.text: Overall I enjoyed the my meal. The food was great (typically yummy hibachi), but the environment could have been better. You typically expect a Japanese steak house to be a classy slightly upscale environment & this was a very casual  Japanese steak house. I also thought their ginger dressing on their salad was a little too sour, unlike typical Japanese steak houses. Also their "shrimp sauce" or "yum yum sauce" which is usually my favorite sauce at other Japanese steak houses was terrible. It was a very thick, too much mayo, not enough spice sauce. I was pretty disappointed by that. I think if they upped the experience quality it would be worlds better.

zOxh3dYVmxU5Q8Tw8ymUvg.text: Had high hopes for trying a new place. We love hibachi restaurants (kids dig the flames, Mom & Dad enjoy sushi).   Had a very, very bad experience here. The sushi was practically inedible. The maki was prepared so large that you couldn't fit a piece in your mouth ... which left you either trying to bite it in half, or cut it with a knife, which totally defeats the purpose. The sushi was placed on waaaayyyyy too much rice, leaving you to pluck the fish off of the huge ball of rice. Our server was friendly, but abandoned us for 10+ minutes at a time on more than one occasion (and even longer at the end of our meal, when everyone was way past ready to leave). For the kicker, when she brought the bill, an 18% gratuity was automatically added. When I asked about this, I was told that it's added for parties of four (4!) or more. I totally understand factoring in gratuities for large parties, but let me tell you ... adding it to a family of four is pure presumption.   I have seldom been more dissatisfied with a dining experience.

bbimMDcORy0OkWdkxsjkpA.text: I went to Yokoso for Valentine's day with my girlfriend for an afternoon cocktail and some sushi before catching a flick at the theater. We ventured into the deserted steakhouse and sat down by the bar around 2:00, expecting to catch a movie at 3:30.   The menu was definitely a little overwhelming at first, so we both ordered a drink to review each others' palates for sushi. My girlfriend ordered a banana split martini and was very delighted with her choice. I noticed that they had some different types of Japanese beer on tap. I ordered the Kirin and happened to love its light, refreshing taste.   After deciphering the menu, my lover ordered the paradise roll, which was an eight cut roll that included crab, avocado, and shrimp. I ordered the spicy tuna, which was also an eight roll that included yellow fin tuna, avocado, and crab. Both of our dishes were delicious.  In a fantasy sushi oasis, I couldn't picture sushi tasting any better. And for everything, we paid around $30.00. So, it was definitely an awesome way to catch a drink and a meal before a movie.

uP6R5hbKGPFIVPlykjlTYw.text: I'm a vegetarian, and the vegetarian hibachi/sushi combo just fails to impress.  Largish portions, at least.  For hibachi, I don't know where else to go.  For sushi, both Chaya and Umi come immediately to mind.  For a large group, it's hard to beat Yokoso, though, as they have tables that will seat groups of 12-24.

photos.caption: Photo of Yokoso Japanese Steakhouse - Homestead, PA, United States

scgAmXc7rTMjc2L3vNIQYg.text: Just the facts:  The worst hibachi style meal in Pittsburgh. Try Benihana for the food or Nakama for the atmosphere. I live by the Waterfront and frequent all of the restaurants located there.

xXBOhqudVxZXguqn_0N2Ng.text: Yokoso is one of the few privately owned restaurants at The Waterfront, the other is the newly christened and defunct Fuddruckers, now the Pittsburgh Burger Co.  I have a real problem with Sushi snobs, first most don't know what they're talking about, for example, at Yokoso one night I swear this really happened....a lady and her date ordered three rolls each, one of which was a dragon roll, a very spicy roll that basically masks the taste of the fish the roll is made from. Then complained that the yellowfin was not fresh. How did she know? She drowned her dragon roll with soy sauce, then piled on pickled ginger and wasabi, rendering her tastebuds useless.   If you want to taste the freshness of the sea, you eat sashimi, and just eat it with a few drops of soy sauce or none at all. Yokoso is one of the top sushi/teppanyaki spots in Pittsburgh.   Great feel inside, comfortable atmosphere, big bar area, nice selection of vodkas, great martini menu.   I'm not a huge fan of teppanyaki although I've had the salmon here and it's very good. I come here for sashimi and since going vegan, I come for the California rolls, and anything the chef comes up with. We are on a first name basis and he has made me vegan dragon rolls, which are pretty amazing. Great lunch specials and weekend evenings can be busy with a bit of a wait. Bar fills up quickly, so come early.

7EgnNBVtzCWA_atZCF5SAw.text: Came here for sushi and it was average at best. More cucumber than fish in my rainbow roll and the "crab" was the stick not real crab. Got a side of fried rice with the yum yum (or pink) sauce and it was not what you'd expect from a hibachi restaurant. Corn in the fried rice (not bad just not typical) and the yum yum sauce wasn't great. Service was fine but will not be coming back.

7DnDpe4ZzJ93bFDmG1_fJQ.text: Went here today for sushi and I was not impressed. It seemed as though both my server, and the person making my sushi, were incredibly new. The rolls were warm and poorly executed making them difficult to eat. If you have an allergy, speak up! The menu does not accurately reflect what is in every sushi roll.

nFoobL5aVi--tVuU67dEDA.text: Sushi at yokoso is overpriced and mainly fillers like a thick layer of rice and a handful of cucumber... You might find a thin layer of fish in there as well.

fh5YsZxZ0YqT34s_LHjL9w.text: Yokoso... More like YUCK-oso.  We walked in on a busy Saturday night and sat at the sushi bar.  It took almost 10 minutes for our server to greet us. I ordered a Heineken, which turned out to the best part of the meal. The wife ordered a glass of Woodbridge Pinot Noir that she said tasted like it had been open for a month.  We started off with an order of edamame (which looked and tasted like it was frozen, and then overcooked), and miso soup which was quite bland. For dinner we ordered the Red Dragon roll, the Three Rivers roll and the Polamalu roll. All three rolls were not impressive at all.  We left having the same bloated feeling that you get when eating cheap MSG-loaded Chinese food. The server took another long while to pick up our check when we were finished. We won't be coming here again.

M2Y-QxO_jMnTQ6SNSLRWdw.text: Grody!  I walked in and was overwhelmed by a really unpleasant smell, but I soldiered on.  Then, while at the sushi bar, I see the sushi chef putting fake crab on my plate.  I immediately stopped him, confirmed the crab was fake, and got the hell out of there as fast as I could. No, no, no, no, no!

E5ba3CjFx_0ZSnvZ1LoAiw.text: Their sushi rolls are a must have. The imperial dinner will last you two meals. Just excellent.

hdPggUpfM1wNPVTj0o3prQ.text: I was here twice. First time, when I was here with three other friends, we didn't have an exceptionally great time. However, I wanted to give it one more chance and I decided to take my friends out for dinner to celebrate my graduation. We had two kids and a vegetarian in a party of 6 people. When I requested a separate hibachi table, they agreed to that. So, that was a good start.  Our waitress, Summer was extremely patient and very accommodating. She was able to handle all the special requirements we mentioned. And luckily, we also had a very accommodating and friendly chef Tommy. Both the kids had lots of fun and they said Yokoso is their favorite restaurant now. Apart from entertaining the kids, Tommy was very careful with the vegetarian option. He handled the vegetarian food first so that there is no mix up of food while he took care of the rest of the hibachi chicken order.   Coming to the food, I highly recommend the spring rolls. They are small in quantity, but very tasty. One hibachi chicken easily serves 2-3 people depending on your appetite. The fried rice is any regular fried rice.   Overall, the price is worth the experience! I recommend this place for large groups and kids above 5 years.

k6vd_8I6bZBS2wWnxeJTcg.text: Great place to eat! The service and atmosphere was second to none. Our chef was professional and our meal was cooked to perfection. We absolutely loved our grill - table mates. They were celebrating a birthday and even shared their homemade birthday cake. The sushi was absolutely wonderful, and tasted great.

LchankjCOnlQjiqLDF2zfg.text: I tried to visit here for the first time tonight, and left disappointed. I'm very particular about my sushi, and asked if I could place an order of sashimi of just salmon and a side of sushi rice. I offered to pay an upcharge; and was told the chef's don't allow substitutions. Especially on a busy night. Its a Tuesday; but I guess due to their half price rolls that constitutes busy.  Oh well, lost a customer before you even had one. That's cool; I'd rather go to Sushi Fuku anyways.

rnpA3T-iGVzwiMiTVtgMVA.text: This is a mixed review so I will start with the good. We sat at a table in the sushi bar area and our server Sandra was awesome. She was prompt and attentive. The sushi was tasty and fresh not any complaints on taste. We gave had better in other cities. But for Pittsburgh it was good. One person at our table ordered a hibachi dinner and was pleased.   Now for the bad we made reservations for 6:45 on a Saturday for a party of 6. We arrive about 5 minutes late due to parking. The three girls at the hostess stand tell us they are waiting for a table to finish and they will push two together for us. We watch them clean a table where they told us we would be  At 7:10 we see two empty next to each other and ask when we would be seated. The hostess tells us they are waiting for the party at the next table over from the already two empty tables to finish but they have already closed out their check. The other party is still eating at 7:20. At 7:25 the table we are waiting for is brought their check. Finally at 7:30 we are seated.  So 45 minutes after our reservation time we get seated.  While the sushi was good the variety was lacking. They have 45 different rolls with the exact same ingredients tuna, shrimp and tempura.  Almost every roll had tempura in it whether it was tempura shrimp or crab or tempura flakes!  Definitely not pleased with the selection.

4GmRJhJR-9zI2GQnSQGpZw.text: Love this place!!! Everyone is so nice and their food is soooo good!!! Can't wait to go back anyone that hasn't been here needs to check it out....the chicken and shrimp is my favorite which is what I got

photos.caption: Photo of Yokoso Japanese Steakhouse - Homestead, PA, United States. Chicken and shrimp

Ctu9NEazsC1RH2VtKd1jmw.text: Stopped in for my quick sushi fix. The food was average to say the least. I ordered the spicy tuna roll and Philadelphia roll, which are my go to when trying a new spot. The quality/taste of the fish was below average, however presentation on the plate was excellent! Service was attentive and nice.

7rwHRgDqE-7-Kekq__zUAg.text: I came on a Monday afternoon so the Waterfront was pretty empty. As a result, i didn't have to deal with any wait.  The food is pretty amazing here. I had a teriyaki salmon with a shrimp tempura roll. The teriyaki salmon was fairly standard and came with a nice mushroom soup and fried rice. I really liked the sushi roll which was nice and crispy.  Lastly, the staff is very attentive and polite. :)

photos.caption: Photo of Yokoso Japanese Steakhouse - Homestead, PA, United States
Photo of Yokoso Japanese Steakhouse - Homestead, PA, United States
Photo of Yokoso Japanese Steakhouse - Homestead, PA, United States

ZacKK9jLiyBlhUIOV-UDUA.text: My wife and I stubbled into Yokoso this week and we were pleasantly surprised with this place. We go to teppanyaki style restaurants about once every 6 weeks or so but hadn't been to Yokoso. Our chef's name was Jaymar and he did not disappoint. He was funny, engaging, and made the entire experience unique. The portion sizes were very large and the food was good. I had the filet mignon and it was wonderful. We will definitely be coming back to Yokoso with the entire family in the very near future.

xMbs55-OtXPepoYYSJQqJg.text: The sushi was delicious!!! We are out of towners, so really appreaciated some really great food! We sat at the bar. The bartender was good too.

5XuuNfFOOTBX9CYWKJ-zGQ.text: Service was slow and mediocre. If you're expecting a show, go elsewhere. The food was just"ok"; not bad but not anything out of the ordinary. The hostess is a bit snotty. She said if you are celebrating a birthday you get15% off but only if you're check is for 4 or more people. Our table had 10 but with 4 separate checks, did not qualify. They charged an automatic gratituity even on 2 take-out orders. Usually the chef at hibachi restaurants is entertaining and funny. Our was just an ordinary joe doing his job and offering small talk.

mQkuaALBxJBz8YQuPEJKWA.text: The food was really good here. Our waiter was fun and very nice. I would definitely go here again if I lived nearby.

a_774pis9W6FYatS3zbC3g.text: My bf was in the mood for sushi but never strays away from his normal place. i decided we should head to waterfront for dinner to change things up. Our server was Ashley and she was seriously an amazing server. Bobby ordered the yum yum roll, lobster cali roll & volcano roll. The only one I tried was the yum yum but it was delicious! Even though we sat at booth seating, i ordered hibachi chicken which of course comes with a salad, soup, chicken, rice, 3 shrimp & veggies. I enjoyed my dinner and couldn't finish all of it.   For a japenese steakhouse, they play a funny (but entertaining) mix of music. We were seated near the sushi bar but still close to the regular bar. We heard everything from  snoop doggs 'aint nothing but a g thang' , tlc's 'no scubs' & oasis 'wonderwall' (what a funny mix)   bobby brought up how he felt the sushi was 'average' It was tasty, but the plating could've been better. You can have average sushi on an amazing looking plate and get points. I agree, the plating of the sushi was lacking.   What boosted this review up was deff the service & the fact that we had a nice date night overall :)  **1/2 off sushi on Tuesday

5hLV_UkDC_WTjER310KUIA.text: This is by far my favorite sushi I've ever had! The Rose roll was phenomenal! The service was great and the food came out fast at lunch time. I saw on the front sign they have special sushi rolls half off on Tuesday! Go! You will love it!

Pw8DxfADxCCToEyxGbBBqQ.text: So we had s girl luncheon after the movie close now.  There were 7 adult females and 3 little girls 6 to 4. The waitress was very responsive with drink orders and then with regular orders. She brought out our soups or salads and then ...chirp...nothing! Finally after 10 min or so a friendly female cook came out and did the normal hello welcome. We asked the cook why we had the wait and she said the "men in the kitchen" didn't want to wait on a table like ours!!!!!!! They were fighting on who was to cook and she finally said she would! And she did a wonderful job and we tipped her well!! Really? I know 14 women who WONT be coming back!!

4o8x2aKscqNmOYfko3E_aw.text: I wish I could give this two ratings - one for hibachi (which I've only done there once) and one for the general dining/sushi.  I really love the sushi at Yokoso and highly recommend the restaurant for that. The one time I went to hibachi there, I was completely unimpressed. The food was okay, but the show was terrible and the prices are higher than restaurants that do a better job. Skip the hibachi - get sushi!

8B-moIwU6JghlNZJxF6fKQ.text: Yokoso can be expensive but it's worth it. I also recently discovered that they do takeout but what's the fun in that? The positions are huge, the drinks can be a bit watered down at times but the sushi...the sushi is truly the reason I keep coming back. I've been to this place numerous times and haven't had a bad experience. My favorite is the hibachi shrimp and chicken and fried rice. I also must attempt to make the soup they offer as an appetizer because it's so good and it seems so simple but I know better! Yes hibachi is paying someone to play with your food while they cook it but it's so entertaining especially when you get the right chef.

JCPbXGd4v761AHSXisTjYw.text: It's not my favorite place for Sushi/Hibachi but it is decent. The service at the bar was good. The happy hour specials are worth checking out.

HGLQvQ6QQ8ZMiAgaLnH_6w.text: This is the second time we have been here and I regret that I have never been there before.  The food is great, the servers are friendly but Cliff the Chef is outstanding.  We were for fortunate enough to have Cliff both times and he is so personable and friendly... I cannot say enough good things about him.   The food here is so very good.  Other hibachi grills bring you a bowl of white rice and charge extra for fried rice.  Not here, everyone gets fried rice and it is cooked in front of you.  And the portions are great.   I cannot rate their sushi as I am not a fan of it, but the hibachi part is fantastic.  We will all be going back again and again. Yes, the Waterfront is busy, but there is always parking available.

25XfcTJHqDoBSuS-7LhrSA.text: It was date night and I just bought an Enjoy book. Of course wanting to get my money's worth, we decided to use Yokoso's. I'm not really one for Asian food, but I enjoy it once in a blue moon (or when my boyfriend begs me).   The night started out rough. After being seated, it took between 5-10 minutes for our server to come by. The very friendly manager noticed how long we were sitting and came by and took our drink orders. We ordered two wines and upon dropping them off he assured us they were on the house. This is good customer service! Our waitress was nice, but seemed to be new or in training.   Our food was great! Such a great deal! We got soup, salad, entrees and sides. So much food but I somehow finished it all! My chicken was flavorful and cooked perfectly. I also enjoyed the dressing on the salad.   We didn't notice that the coupon technically wasn't valid during the time of our visit, but they still honored it anyways. I'm guessing they noticed how the beginning of our visit flopped so they stepped up to the plate! I want to thank the manager on duty (wish I would have got his name), because you made the night wonderful. The night could have been a huge disappointment, but stepping in to comp certain parts of the meal truly shows how you go above and beyond to make guests happy. We definitely will be returning!

xt3vCTxonOP4dqftfCiTeA.text: Trash establishment. Just cares about making a buck and not about their customers. Sushi is mediocre. Management is terrible. Menu is over priced and not worth it. Tried to give this restaurant a second chance after my first bad experience and wish I hadn't wasted my money.

aak4wOga876sOkXSx5X6zQ.text: We dropped in for an afternoon snack after finding out the Mexican place across the road had been replaced by a Primanti's. Looking around we saw Yokosa and said "Let's have noodles!"  We got a seat right away at a booth.  My side was pretty uncomfortable like all the wires under the padding were pointing up. Yee haah!  Ha ha, gave us something to laugh about!  We didn't find much in the way of noodles on the menu except for the yakisoba so we got that and another appetizer.  Food was good although seemed pricey.  They add tip suggestions on the bill but instead of percentages they had fair, good, and excellent. I did the math and fair came to 18% of the pretax subtotal.

_BlUuXQmIfu5_bnuMs1R5A.text: Maybe the steak at this place is ok, but the hibachi veggie dinner was a disaster. Had to ask about the salad and miso (which was beef stock disguised as miso, as if there were such a thing!) along with the shrimp appetizer that all should've come BEFORE my dinner. A plate of sloppily thrown together over salted rice and zucchini with one or two pieces of broccoli and onion - not to mention CORN. Sorry but Yuckoso is my new name for this place!

iu_vMXUoo7aOrGav6EtZPg.text: Best sushi in town. Hibachi is also excellent. Come in on Tuesday's (dine-in only) for half off sushi. Their fried rice is also my favorite! I believe their yum yum sauce is made in house, and it's amazing.

25039ml9XO2xe4m_3w1gKQ.text: Awesome place to take the family. Wife loves the sampler player, they have sushi for everyone, and the chefs are very entertaining. It's almost feels like family. Highly recommend.

6MvfE6iLRvroERiG5yBLkw.text: Aaron was an amazing chef to us! And, Jackie was an amazing waitress! We had a wonderful time!

vCJfiZfoOB_asPwLE-mqAw.text: My friend and I met here for lunch today. It was absolutely delicious and Cliff, our chef, was personable and made great food!! I was not sure what to expect because each hibachi restaurant is different but I must say this experience was the best I have had! I ordered the steak and shrimp and ordered some scallops on the side. It was so good! I ate about 1/3 of my lunch and was completely stuffed! I highly recommend and can't wait to return! Our server was great too but I forgot her name!

gsvBeYAOMa90yZbj9Hh_Cg.text: Yokoso is our favorite sushi spot EVER! Server Lauren M is the main reason why we keep coming back even after moving away from the area, and the deep fried rolls are literally the best that we have ever had anywhere. I especially recommend the Pirate Roll with the crunchy asparagus and smooth cream cheese. Their hibachi is also top notch for taste and environment. If you're in the Pittsburgh area, don't miss this gem :)

photos.caption: Photo of Yokoso Japanese Steakhouse - Homestead, PA, United States

3PsfqvHuGCWJLrE0dvrfQA.text: I haven't been here in years so a friend and I decided to stop by for dinner! The inside is very nice; very clean and modern, it is a bit dark and also our booth seat was very broken in, I sunk down in my chair! Kinda weird but not a deal breaker of course..  I started off with the house salad w/ ginger dressing (so good!) and then ordered the Yum Yum roll and the Pink Lady roll for my main course.   The Yum Yum roll was delicious and I really liked the crunchy tempura flakes on top. Normally sushi isn't too crunchy and I liked the variety of taste and texture with this roll!  I have heard good things about the Pink Lady roll so I decided to give it a go. While the shredded crab on top was delicious, and the asparagus was yummy, I was not a huge fan of the large amount of cream cheese in the roll. I have never had cream cheese in sushi (I think the Philly style rolls have them) and it just didn't mingle with the other flavors in the roll. I probably would not get again but the presentation was fabulous!  I will ABSOLUTELY be back, especially on a Tuesday when their special rolls are 1/2 off! What a deal!

photos.caption: Photo of Yokoso Japanese Steakhouse - Homestead, PA, United States. Top - Yum Yum roll 5/5 ; Bottom - Pink Lady roll 3/5

Z6YKRcWKe9yZUoEAQOPhHQ.text: From my prior post some will read that I am a huge Chinese, Japanese, Sushi, Hibachi LOVER.   Yokoso's in the Waterfront is my favorite Hibachi restaurant hands down. I love it. with or without a coupon for lunch or dinner I GO!   We start off with an appetizer every visit. The Sushi here is very good, but I like the Hibachi. Our appetizer of choice is: the Sampler Platter ( 12pcs - in those 12 you receive, beef gyozas, shrimp shumais, shrimp tempura, and spring rolls. Must try !!  I love the Chicken & Salmon Hibachi lunch or dinner. I have had the Chicken with Steak. I always choose the soup over the salad, but I do like the ginger dressing. I am not a huge iceberg lettuce fan. The show that the chefs display when cooking is entertaining. I like having the food prepared in front of me. I know what I am eating and how it was prepared.   Highly Recommend. We support on a regular restaurant rotation.

EXxKj8IH0apPMxN5sXmXFg.text: I love this place! As a sushi fan, half price Tuesdays are the sole reason I come here. The hibachi comes in huge portions and is very good. But half price special rolls cannot be bear. The rolls do not appear as fancy or decorative as some other sushi places in the area, but for how good they are and at half price, you cannot beat it.

photos.caption: Photo of Yokoso Japanese Steakhouse - Homestead, PA, United States. Volcano Roll and Yokoso Roll

qhxvbQDmVKemJVogSF-bJw.text: Great food here. We had the hibachi, so I'm not entirely sure of their regular menu The chef puts up an amazing show for everyone (keep your eyebrows safe :) ). The food is also very good, cooked to perfection. Has a huge portion and some very interesting flavours. Their sauces are just too good! I would highly recommend the hot sauce they have. The ginger sauce on the salads is great too My only complain is the lack of variety in the vegetables they serve with the rice. There are so many options, but they just serve some relatively bland ones

mZEJ322GVnDQeR1Wt7TdfQ.text: My girlfriend and I have come to Yokoso a total of three times over the past 6 months, and each visit has displayed a tangible decrease in quality.  The service was great the first time we went, and the sushi platter we got was fresh and delicious.    The second time we went there we had to wait a while for our waitress to  take our order.  The restaurant wasn't busy so I have no idea where she was.  When we did make our order of the sushi/sashimi platter, the waitress asked us "y'all do know that's raw fish right?" I was absolutely dumbfounded. If your employees don't understand that raw fish is a totally normal staple of Japanese cuisine, and that this is common knowledge, they should not be your employees. Despite that, the food itself was good, if not spectacular.  Tonight we went back to give Yokoso another try. It was a busier night, so we forgave the waitress for being slow to greet us and take our order of the sashimi platter.  The server didn't say anything offensive, so that was a relief.  When we got to the salmon sashimi, we noticed that it was still frozen solid. We had saved the salmon for last since it is usually our favorite, so we didn't bother complaining.  Blatantly frozen fish is a massive no-no when it comes to sushi.  Our complaint wouldn't have changed anything if the restaurant was willing to serve frozen fish in the first place.    After our meal we were still a little hungry and didn't know why until we realized that our server did not bring us the soup and salad that was supposed to come with our meal.  We were not vigilant and the restaurant took advantage of that.  We also tried ordering the sea urchin sushi out of curiosity, and apparently the restaurant has never had sea urchin. Why put it on the menu then? Why would the waitress think telling us that would be a good idea?  TLDR; this restaurant features frozen fish, lackadaisical quality control, and can have some pretty bad service.  It can occasionally be good, but so can most other restaurants.

Q0iMM0teElIb9LWB6WxeDA.text: Decent hibachi place. The worst thing I have to say is that the Waterfront area in general is always crazy packed and hard to find parking. The food is good, the server was attentive and always filled my water. The chef was personable and did an excellent job. They do just put fried rice on the grill, unlike other places I've been to that turn white rice into fried rice in front of you. On Tuesday's all the specialty sushi rolls are half price which is awesome. And they give you SO MUCH food. My friend and I split the chicken hibachi dinner and a sushi roll and it was still a ton of food. The picture I've attached is just half of a chicken hibachi dinner. The other is half a sushi roll.  It is a bit pricey. However, most hibachi places I've been to have been similarly priced. And they do give you a lot of food. Also, just a warning, they give tip suggestions on the bottom of the receipt. I did the math for a 20% tip and it was still lower than what they said a "fair" tip is. So do the math if you go, unless you think you had AMAZING service.

65DCTvuqTOqDyvgf5_NucQ.text: Tried this place years ago, and it was not good, so we didn't try it again until last night. Now with kids, our dining criteria has changed.   Called at 4:20 to ask about availability at 5:30 for 8 people (2 families). Was told reservations can't be made less than 2 hours in advance but that there wasn't a wait at the moment. I took the first reservation they would make as a backup plan (6:30-after their 2 hour requirement). Figured we'd go in and wait for a table, with worse case that we wait until 6:30 or decide to go elsewhere. Arrived at 5:40. After the hostess confirmed with other staff, we were told they had a table leaving and we'd be seated shortly. We waited 25 minutes. No big deal for the 5 adults, but rough for the hungry little kids. They had mistakenly given the table they had cleared to another walk in party. At 6:05 we were told it would be another 15 minutes. They continued to seat other parties of 8. At 6:30 we were told it would be a while longer.   Neither the hostess nor manager were well equipped to handle a busy restaurant.  After being told we would be sat shortly when we arrived, we waited 50 minutes before giving up.  We left with a sobbing four year old and ate elsewhere. If we had been told they couldn't sit us for roughly an hour, we would have sat at the non hibachi tables that go largely empty all night.  We're going to Ichiban tonight to make it up to the disappointed kids.

VQWSCYIV_IXiHWX1xvYxpg.text: If this place had amazing food and bad service i would've come back. multiple times i needed something and had to bother the hostess for it because our waiter was mia and she literally had to radio him in for our add in orders. we were sitting for around an hour had four people at our table and were desperately thirsty after being in the sun all day and our waters were refilled once. i like to think im not high maintenance but this guy didn't seem to come to work to work. the sushi was ok, the portion size was decent. im at the waterfront all the time and I see no reason to come back to an ok sushi spot with subpar service.

bt25ddIJ4-nYt3cSC7ib2w.text: The girl had the nerve to be as rude as the manager Sydney and didn't even apologize just walk away how do y'all force someone to tip a unprofessional waiter chyna was the worst waiter and very rude but the manager didn't even try to understand the problem she walked away only good person was the cook who

-yEIPt-nZh7VU436Fkfszg.text: Omg I love this place! Been to Pittsburgh twice and came here on both occasions. I ordered the hibachi chicken with noodles and rice... Everything was delicious! And the salad dressing?? I think it is the best salad dressing I ever had... Even better than whatever olive garden uses (my fave) haha. I crushed my salad rather quickly. Can't wait to go back the next time I'm in Pittsburgh!
