Q0V2ANzLxnU6YcOH4l5sKg.text: YOKOSO!  Seriously - your 1/2 off specialty rolls on Tuesday nights is the best day ever.    Their rolls aren't pretty like most other sushi rolls, but - they are GOOD and they have a HUGE variety.  They have some of the normal "specialty" rolls that other places have as well - but be adventurous, try new things!  I have eaten there in the past for hibachi and it was always great.  But now...all I go for is sushi.  On tuesday nights.  Because 1/2 off.  My friend and I greedily split 6 rolls last night.  (we later determined we should get 5 - but have no regrets!  haha)  for $50.  Seriously - when can you get 6 sushi rolls for under $10 a roll - and these are specialty rolls with multiple types of fish in them!  Go check it out - if you are going for sushi - go Tuesdays.  Maybe I'll see you there :)

G946gPQBC7b-dC38Rw88fQ.text: Great food, great show food preparation, grew customer service, prices are resonabas for the amount of food that they serve.

DgYgrOS3eIAcMUArb2bTLg.text: I was pleasantly surprised!!!  I was a bit apprehensive after reading some reviews, because I rely heavily on feedback! Lol.  We celebrated Mother's Day early (on Friday) with party of nine.  The food and the service were both great!!!  The waitress kept our drinks refilled and kept checking on us, while the chef put on a great show and prepared delicious food!  The scallops and shrimp were really good--as were the filet mignon and chicken.  However, the lobster was a bit more "chewy" than we like it.  We will definitely return!  *For some strange reason, the raspberry tea was VERY GOOD, or I was just really thirsty!

jbsQLB_fhghNdhLRhSVngg.text: Never going back. When I travel to Pittsburgh, this has been a weekly carry out back to my hotel. Quality good.  Service good. Tonight, when I get back to hotel I see they forgot a portion of of my order. I call and they say they have it so I walk back to get it When I walk in they say I forgot my order. I had to explain that they forgot to pack it. The rest of my order was sitting on the bar. As I left I mentioned I did not receive an apology. I was ignored by 3 people on my way out. When I get back to hotel I find they also forgot to pack utensils, chopsticks, and soy sauce. Not going back .. not tonight, not ever.

97Sn37CoDzspkUjJ3g-5Mg.text: Sushi is worth it especially during the happy hour specials ( 1/2 off rolls tuesdays and Thursday's). My favorite roll is called " Japanese Mafia #2".   The hibachi is okay, especially coming from someone who has been to many hibachis. The staff isn't that friendly or great at the hibachi side. Orders got mixed up too which happens at the sushi side too.

pha3zoCKq0M_LleHngQ9KA.text: We chose this restaurant to celebrate a friend's birthday and were disappointed in the food quality and overall experience.   Now for the food. The soup was the standard clear broth with a few mushroom slices. It was awful. The salad was actually quite tasty. We all had the steak and shrimp. In general, the flavor was just so-so. Much of the preparation was not done at the table. The fried rice was already prepared (except for the egg which was fried on the grill) and reheated on the grill. The shrimp and steaks were grilled tableside but the showmanship was lacking. I could have prepared the food with more flair.  Bottom line is that the flavor was just OK. Nothing special and not what other Japanese steakhouses offer.

euUT5UoGSF8XXk9lrSVZXw.text: Tuesday's is 1/2 off speciality rolls-great deal. Beer i got was flat, 0 bubbles. Waitress was not attentive and never actually cleared our plates and only refilled our waters once. That being said the sushi is awesome! i love the variety and they give you a booklet with pictures of every roll so you can also see what you will get. I've been here several times and the food doesn't disappoint but the service can.

kbPW41731-uuD2rPWhWEjw.text: What a treat this was!!! Four adults and two kids made up our group. We were seated at a table where two others were already sitting. Got to say, I wasn't wild about that. I know it's tepenyaki (sp?) and it's like a community to watch the chef cook, but we were a large group and the others felt weird and so did we. Regardless, the chef arrived and the show began. We started off with three sushi rolls and they were fantastic!! I ordered chicken and my guy ordered beef and shrimp. Loved the meal!!! The meats were cooked at the table as was the fried rice and veggies. With juggling the eggs and making a volcano with an onion,  the kids were fascinated! Everything was so very tasty and our waitress was friendly and helpful! Definitely would return and would do this all over again!! Kudos!

7AM4gCiNs378i2WjrX3mBQ.text: This place was pretty good. Ended up here because everything at the Waterfront was packed on Friday night. We got seated right away in the bar area, I prefer to bypass the hibachi tables because it typically is much quicker. Our service was great. They have a large drink menu but didn't have any specials. I split the chicken hibachi with someone, our waitress brought us two separate salads and miso soups which I thought was pretty nice. The chicken hibachi was pretty good, especially the chicken itself. Something seemed a little off with the fried rice but the veggies were good. It was a little pricy overall.

JgIJnZGz_qhpQHByvd5U8Q.text: The hibachi was pretty good at Yokoso and I'd get it again.  We had a fun chief who kept us entertained.  I'm normally not a fan of ginger dressing but I did enjoy theirs and do recommend it.  We had a side of soba noodles and a side of mushrooms both could have used more spice for my taste.  The noise level was pretty loud because the place was packed.

MlILLiJ1xZCZnm9DZWxSMg.text: Sushi chef Kevin ruined my experience there. He was rude and made everything difficult from the beginning. He wouldn't let me order from him so I waited for our waitress while she was running around helping everyone else. Eventually I ordered the $22.00 sushi platter. I asked if I could pay extra to add avocado to the top of the California roll. She said sure. He cut her off and said no. The idea of paying extra for a couple slices of avocado blew his mind. He refused to add avocado even for an upcharge. Most sushi places charge a couple bucks. How hard is it to add some avocado on top of the California roll? Luckily we were bar hopping so i left and found somewhere else to eat. Oh well...Maybe they should try to accommodate their guests. We were each ready to have a few drinks before the comedy show across the street.

TOV6ykmouMvJaLC7aHZ7zg.text: Not a place you should go if you have food allergies, they don't have an allergy menu. My server asked me if things had my allergy in them.... All in all I think she did her best so I'm not upset with my service. My food was good, I just wish I didn't have to be so careful because restaurant should really have allergy information available for customers, please consider doing this for your customers.

CF1FdS_bi3znV8zxBU0kRw.text: I have to give 2 stars here, and I'm sad because the food was very disappointing. Our service was fine, and quick. My friend and I sat at the bar. Our cocktails were fine, but the food was horrible. The fried rice looked gross either from frozen vegetables or old rice, the shrimp was over cooked, and the filet I got was a very small portion and hardly tender. The vegetables were not fresh, and the yum yum sauce was more mayo than anything. I wanted to try something other than my usual hibachi place, but that will not happen again lol.

o3AwkfbEAnD4R-JgC2hBgw.text: Yokoso is my favorite Japanese restaurant in Pittsburgh. I have been a customer here dozens of times for several years. I always order sushi for an appetizer and a hibachi dinner (either the filet mignon with scallops or the salmon). The food always tastes very good. The service is also always good.

5toEOXM84Ca3-xwGJu0Knw.text: I have never met a hostess crew so miserable, so rude, so apathetic.  We arrived from Kennywood with 1/2 of our group who was coming right behind us.  When we asked for a table the hostess said we can't take a reservation until your party is all here and even then the wait will be "at least an hour or more".  She had no emotion and little eye contact.  We decided to get a smaller table and spit the tables.  When we were seated there were multiple tables open.   The hostesses up front were on their cell phones with heads down.  We asked to talk to the manager.   The service is horrible.  Overpriced. Unfriendly.  Next time....it's Primantis across the street!!

XYIssknDcVX-zwBUb9gGdA.text: Didn't pack a lunch so got their salad and avocado rolls.   Their ginger dressing and house salad is excellent.   The avocado  rolls were good, too. Looking forward to returning.

prsQ1fdk9Ve7ZFi_8oyugQ.text: I was very disappointed with this location. At the entrance I let the hostess know I was celebrating my fiance's birthday and I had made a reservation and I would wait for a good booth. She ignored and disregarded my request because she sat us immediately and when I requested a different area, she ignored me again. After a few minutes my fiance and I left and went to Benihana in Greentree. No lie, the service at that Benihana was exceptional.

NqFxWETH3L0dwWwqnozAQg.text: T e r r i b l e  Took me a solid 4 minutes to chew on a piece of steak. The fried rice was gross and vegetables were not fresh. Never coming here again, don't waste your money.

5babOB80U4IzUsSH_0746g.text: Wondered why it was so empty and after 10 minutes of not being acknowledged at the bar despite the hostess 5 feet away, a manager literally sitting AT the bar and multiple people behind the bar, it was pretty obvious. Failing customer service = failing business. Owner needs an entire front of house staff overhaul, currently being sabotaged by clowns

Ol3YojsKUKvNeFNoj0T09w.text: Tuesday is 1/2 off specialty sushi rolls. I decided to bring my wife, who is not normally a big fan of sushi, to introduce her to the different rolls and kinds of sushi. We ordered three different rolls and they all were delicious. We enjoyed the sushi and I was able to convince my wife to return for another sushi date!  In short, the sushi is good. The service: not so much. Once we were seated, we had to wait a while for our waitress to even come to our table. Our waitress took our order and refilled our drinks once, and that was all that we saw of her during our whole meal. Very disappointing.  Would I return to Yokoso, yes. Would I go out of my way to come back, no. The sushi was good and the 1/2 off special was a plus, but the service we received was a turnoff.

xd9wa0-vsX8Eo1leO5ytSg.text: Made a reservation for a group of Four. We were promptly seated once we arrived, and within 15 minutes had our drinks from the bar, as well as our soup and salads. Our hibachi master was James, and he was EXCELLENT. Very friendly and entertaining. Would highly recommend, but do make a reservation, as the places can get very busy on weekends!

n3IIyzuTJmm-i7f1ElPSwQ.text: Came here for the 1/2 off sushi night on Tuesday. Although it was very crowded when we arrived, we didn't have to wait too long for a table.   I ordered the Plummy yummy cocktail which was good but a little strong for my taste. My friend however thought it was perfect; so if you like strong drinks, go for that one! Each person in my group ordered two rolls, which ended up being plenty of food. The rolls were huge! However, they were all pretty similar in terms of the fillings and toppings. Pretty much every roll on the menu was topped with a bunch of spicy crab. Now I like spicy crab, but it was way too much. They definitely skimped on the fish in my opinion as well. Maybe it's different when you order on the non half price nights, or maybe it's the two rolls I ordered, but overall I wasn't blown away by the sushi. I would still come back just because it was such a great deal, but only if I was craving some specialty rolls rather than actual fish.

photos.caption: Photo of Yokoso Japanese Steakhouse - Homestead, PA, United States. 1/2 off sushi night!

7HpncAHfBK_KSKQZNXXI6Q.text: Fabulous dining experience. We were able to sit in the bar area and watch the Pirates game on 2 giant TVs. The service was warm, friendly and accommodating. Our food was promptly provide. The salad was fresh and chilled.  We ordered the vegetable and shrimp dinner. The vegetables were cooked to perfection....not too crisp or soft.  The shrimp was a generous portion size and also cooked perfectly. We will certainly be back. Thanks for a great evening!

skIhu9uQsD1JZwGakjXNJw.text: We've eaten here a number of times. Mostly sushi but once at the teppanyaki tables (or hibachi to you hillbilly yinzfolk). Its always pretty good. But definitely not the best. We like it, though.  This time, I ordered something I've been wanting for awhile, a bowl of udon. We also got three rolls, an asparagus salad, some fried rice and a side of brocolli. The last time we were here, we sat down at the teppanyaki tables and ordered the brocolli for our 2 year old. We got pretty much a half pound of "trees" as she calls them and munched them down. Our order yesterday was only about a dozen pieces, which was a disappointment.  The udon was okay. I ordered the small, as the waitress said the large was very large. Props on the noodles...big and thick, chewy and firm. There was plenty of tofu inside and it was cooked in a way that gave it the texture and flavor of chicken. I got three large tempura prawns that were cooked perfectly. The broth was a little lackluster. And since I recently started having to watch my sodium, I had to leave the soy sauce alone. The soup was good but I probably wouldn't order it again.  The rolls were all good as usual. She got the California roll, the veggie roll and the Rock n Roll (shrimp, cream cheese, cucumber). Their sushi is priced pretty much the same as all the other sushi I've found in town. They have a couple sushi combos, and we've gotten these before, they're real deals. Individually picking the rolls can get pricy, though.  Finally, the salad. They have a green salad on the menu for $3.50. Its pretty small for that much money. Or you can get a few other salads for about $5.95. They double the size of the lettuce plus they put some asparagus or some other veggies on it. If you're gonna grab a salad, skip the $3.50 one and get the large size, its worth it.  The fried rice was pretty tasty. But for the two of us and the baby, it was overkill. Lots of egg and veggies in it.   Their teppanyaki lunches are priced great. You get plenty of food for $9-15 bucks. All in all, their prices are just a little higher than average for teppanyaki/sushi. Not as high as Nakama, plus the quality is better. Their lunch teppanyaki deals are real steals, though. Honestly, I like several other places more but their location makes it easy to do lunch after shopping.

KEsvDGdnTXokyxecmDaqQg.text: Still sick and suffering!! We knew we where going to be sick right after we left.   My family spent the last 48 hours in turmoil --  we will not be back.

RvbrRuUTm-feH2lNQ5Bc3Q.text: I live in Philadelphia and I visited Yokoso this last Saturday for one of my best friends' birthday dinner with a group of about 12 people. The staff responsible for taking reservations messed up our friend's reservation which she made several days in advance and we were told to wait for a table (even though we had a scheduled limo coming to pick us up later). After about 20 minutes of waiting, we were finally seated and told that our server would be right with us. We waited another 15 minutes as servers rushed past us, completely oblivious to the fact that our large table hadn't been approached. Finally one of us ended up grabbing a passing waitress, Jasmine, who was extremely nice and offered to take our order herself. She was very accommodating and quickly took our drink and dinner orders, which is no simple task for a twelve top party. Our hibachi chef Cliff was also amazing, very funny and engaging. If it were not for Jasmine and Cliff, we certainly would have walked out and told everyone to stay away from Yokoso! We ended up making our limo reservation but it was unnecessarily stressful and aggravating. This review is getting 2 stars only because of Jasmine and Cliff's excellent service!

lYLDvG_UwPk2SqgUAKb-Yg.text: I ate at Yokoso over the weekend for my sisters birthday (nakama was booked) and wasn't very impressed.  I am not big into the Japanese Steakhouses but I have ate at Nakama in the past.    Enough about that, I ordered sushi (spicy tuna roll) which was very good.  The sushi prices are average and the quality is good.  For dinner I had the strip steak and lobster tail.  I ordered the steak medium and it came out more like well.  The chef was very entertaining but I wish he would have focused on how he was cooking my steak instead of flirting with the single girls at the table.  The lobster tail fit in the palm of my girls hand so I'd have to say it was on the smaller side but still at market price :)    Of course they load you up on soup, veg, and rice hoping you get full.  There was a party of 12 with us and everyone finished their meal except 2.  The waitress and staff were great, the drinks were strong if that counts for anything.  I guess I would go back for a special gathering but it wouldn't be me that choosing to go there.

zu-hR00i7pp5j64pmYtpTQ.text: If I could give it a 0 star rating, I would.  The awful service sent us right back out instead of eating there.  We arrived at 7:00 on a Saturday evening, which I know is a busy time.  All I wanted was to order a snack from the sushi bar.  When we got there, 4 girls were up front in some kind of disarray.  We stood there for a few minutes; no one greeted us, told us they'd be with us soon... no acknowledgment at all.  The sushi bar was practically empty, so we asked loudly if you could seat yourself.  No one replied, so we started walking to the sushi bar.  A girl then came running after us, not to greet us, but to rudely state that the bar wasn't self seating and that there was a wait since the staff was behind.  We then promptly walked out.  I did call the manager, who was very apologetic, but I still won't go back.

DruGds-vWoDgX0fIbZ8lUg.text: We bypass Nakama to come here. Great food, always an available seat without wait, great sushi platters. You can actually order sushi to go from here whereas you can't at Nakama's past a certain early hour. Plus free parking!!!!

EUrlZzOn0SX2y_ZvBoK1xw.text: Hostesses were great and were seated right away.  The sushi was very fresh and the show was one of the best I have seen.  If you are in the area and want some good hibachi come to Yokoso!

CnJGPPmM29jGbGEkgvmo_Q.text: Smell of oil and grease is overwhelming, soup was cold, the salad dressing it not very good and overwhelms the salad.  No coffee, and the loud banging of a drum every time some one had a birthday was irritating and distracted from the meal.  I had a Manhattan to drink and they poured cherry juice in  it. Sickeningly sweet.   I've eaten in a lot of Japanese and hibachi restaurants and this is probably the worst overall experience I've had.

mjUr6llpwl4zqQg96w_H-g.text: Sushi is AMAZING!!!!!!!! Hibachi not so much. Smell of oil and grease is VERY overwhelming. Always had good service.

kHc88PRrcWLXq0racGhM3A.text: Great restaurant! The hibachi cooked right in front of me was great. Atmosphere was amazing and the food was great as well. Excellent wait-staff and cooks!!!

PQIUBzlxs8tW0u-s2qFSSw.text: we didn't do hibachi, just came for sushi and whomp whomp - not so great. i ordered an avocado roll (bc i only get that or sweet potato tempura and they didn't have sweet potato) and it didn't taste fresh. the edamame was luke warm. its in a great location, they just need to work on their food. hm.

Z0zW7NWCjh3lvJpZ9WdS0A.text: the sushi was meh. nothing worth your time. also was a victim of my server's racial ignorance at the time of my visit. i will not be going ever again.

pZAz20f3lZ8pQu9uP6bA4w.text: Not a bad place to go if you would like to do a dinner show then a movie with your significant other.  Went there on a Monday night and we got our own private hibachi table.  The chef was very good and the waitress top notch.  My wife and I had a good time.  Some of the other reviews play this place down as a dive or bad, I would say that I read them and was nervous about going here for the first time.  It was a nice place and worth going to again.  I say make your own opinion and give them a shot.  You may be surprised.

z-00vQyE9T0UmLfmWMQB2A.text: Tastes like a British housewife making Japanese food with American style using Chinese ingredients...

yWduRsUrPoEBaRXnSIwDBQ.text: Came here for hibachi dinner. Our server, Jessica was attentive and handled our large party of 10 with ease. Our chef, Denny was phenomenal and added to the positive experience with his friendly demeanor and skill in putting on a show. A few of the people I was with commented that without Denny, the meal itself would not have been nearly as enjoyable. Would definitely return!

ec_buWp4JKpjONZiDbtE_A.text: Have been coming here for hibachi since they opened. A big fan of the salmon with scallops.   The service : Is a hit or miss depending on who you get. I'm sure it depends on how busy it is as well. Some days I have had excellent service with very friendly servers, and other days I have only had mediocre service. The hostesses tend to be on the grumpier side as well.  The food : Service aside the food has rarely disappointed.  My two favorite chefs so far are Harry and Cliff. Both very friendly and talented.

RHNwfCNmTZHnmO7qYU8vXA.text: Went out with a group of friends for a birthday and while the food was really really really good we had an awful experience. I know they always do the volcano and whatnot with the fire but this guy started off by setting two spatulas on fire and then doing some awesome tricks with them. Well it was cool until he threw one and injured our friend. Our chef threw a flaming spatula at our friend, he was ON FIRE. The worst part of all of this, besides the fact that his arms/hands and shirt were burnt, was the way the staff handled the situation. Our chef looked annoyed that this happened, as if it were somehow my friends fault. He didn't offer to help, hell, he didn't even pick up the spatula (that was still flaming) off the floor. After our shock and us checking to see if our friend was okay, the chef just looks at my friend and says "Sorry about that, buddy" What kind of a response is that????? The manager never came over to check if we were okay, no one offered apologies for what happened, it seemed as if no one even cared if we were okay. I was going to ask to speak with the manager but we decided not to cause a scene. However, I wanted to let people know that this happened because it may happen to you if you get lucky enough!!! I am utterly shocked at the lack of safety and care they showed for their patrons.   Won't be going back again and hoping that my friends burns heal properly.

ne8kSEMcfs1zwrbkfIiFcQ.text: Took my daughters there for a daddy daughters dinner and would say the chef we had was amazing.  Spent extra time interacting with my kids. Food was delicious.  Only sour note was the waitress... we ordered sushi and never received it. She seemed busy and preoccupied.

photos.caption: Photo of Yokoso Japanese Steakhouse - Homestead, PA, United States. Enjoying our dinner at yokoso!!!

Y7wLB_3TRs2r5XahZT42nA.text: I understand the 40+ minute wait on a Friday. Standard. I've been in the food industry as a waitress/bartender for over ten years so I know what it's like to be in the weeds. But shit. Tonight was the worst! The food didn't make up for the inattentive service we received. We will never be back. Not to mention the sub par booths that you feel the persons every move. That was super annoying! To boot it was his birthday and after having a loud drum beat into my ear they lit a firecracker which landed in my food. It really couldn't have gotten any worse.

G6Mzeu7TCUls0t7XIhezMw.text: I cannot believe out of 60 reviews there is no mention of the hibachi chef Cliff. My husband, my 9 year old & my son have eaten here twice now with Cliff as our Hibachi chef & he is nothing short of amazing! Yesterday we went with our close friends & their 2 children. All the kids were shy at first but Cliff does an amazing job at making the kids feel like part of the show. He is such a nice, outgoing guy & made the amazing food he prepared even that much better. My son is very shy but Cliff did an amazing job at getting him to open up & he even ate the shrimp he made after never eating seafood before! (Note:he LOVED it so much cliff requested a few more ounces so he could make him some more) Food is great, service is great, get here now! Need something even more enticing? How about 1/2 % off sushi Tuesday's & their great drinks?!

0I8omO6aZGusgdx91Ps5Ig.text: I've eaten here numerous times and every time is fantastic but this time stood out above all the others. Our chef was Collin... I recommend him hands down. He was personable, he had great flair, he didn't do the same tricks that you usually see. You can tell that he has a passion for his job and he takes pride in it. He is very precise in what he does and his food is amazing. If you come here... Request him. He said he's off Monday's, Tuesday's, and Wednesday's. Hands down the best hibachi chef I've ever had and I've been to almost all the hibachi places in the area.

GmulAnP7ZNnr7sEEV-OpBw.text: Yokoso is my favorite place for Hibachi because the food is spot on every time. The  chef we had was amazing- thorough, gifted in the art of hibachi and passionate. Yokoso is one of the only hibachi restaurants I know that has separate, isolated seating for big groups of people with a cooking area all to its self! This is nice because sometimes you want to enjoy hibachi without being seated with strangers. The ambiance is very nice- dimply lit with a funky vibe to it. The staff is team "Yokoso" so don't bring up Benihana! :-P It is nice to see staff that truly believe in their work and the quality of work that their company brings to the customer. I give this place 5 stars- it is clean, it is updated, and the food is always wonderful! Even if you had designated hibachi favorites in the 'Burgh, please give Yokoso a try! You won't be disappointed!

ALO9E1z0JbNMgJp6w_ql4A.text: Pretty good service .Bartender refused to put smoothie in budda bonzi cup for my boyfriend. Food was great. .. tons left over had enough gor lunch the next two days.. would recommend

8fUNQBZENljVni2NauBcKQ.text: There are two reasons you should ever go to Yokoso: 1) You hate yourself, or 2) your relationship with someone is moving to fast and you want it to end. (take her here, she will hate you.)  I ate there last night, and it was so bad I was certain that I was on a hidden camera show.   To start, I ordered a roll of sushi for their half price Tuesday special. The roll came out 15 minutes later and it was warm. First time in my life that sushi was served warm (ingredients AND rice), as if it had been put in the microwave. It was disgusting. For the main course, I went with NY strip and shrimp. The shrimp was fine but the strip was chewy and wayyyy over cooked because the "Chef" was too busy being an entertainer. The rice was extremely buttery and gross, and the reason for the extra butter brings me to the "Chef."   I have never had the opportunity to describe a chef as "extremely offensive," until tonight. When he first arrived, he noticed all of our dirty dishes from soup/salads were still in front of us. He then starts saying how the waitresses and busboys are useless and how "you get what you pay for, ya know?" He then said how he would "go in the back and get all the migrant workers to come clean up," but he "doesn't speak Spanish". It appears he thinks he is funny. He says how the migrant workers "are only working here so they aren't sent back to Mexico," and follows it up with "they aren't great cooks, but they are great at shoe repair." I sh*t you not. My wife who thankfully wasn't there, is a minority. I can take a joke or a remark (I've taken plenty) but its out of line when its from the person I chose to pay my hard earned money to for a nice dinner. I wanted to get up and leave as soon as he started talking, but I was with a group and didn't want to create a scene.   Because nobody takes away our dirty dishes (at a Hibachi table with 7 people,) the "chef" removes them from the table himself, handling dirty dishes and silverware with his bare hands, stacks them on the table behind him, dries his hands on his pants, then starts handling and cooking our meal! It was disgusting. He then shouts across the restaurant to our non-existent waitress, "Hey babe, can you come help these people out."  After sitting with an empty beer glass in front of me for 20 minutes, my second drink finally arrives. It wouldn't do it justice to say the glass was cracked. It was straight up broken. There were such large cracks in the glass that chunks of it were missing. I show the "chef," he calls over one of the "useless waitresses" (his words,) somehow the manager gets involved, and he (manager) starts calling out the waitress in the middle of the restaurant while she (the waitress) blames it on the bartenders.   (side note: throughout the night, the Manager was taking hits off of a can he placed out of sight at one of the many empty tables. Not certain if it was alcohol, but his slurred speech and total incompetency at his job point a certain direction.)  The "Chef" began by cooking the shrimp and placed it on our plates. Before taking my first bite of the meal, he says "hurry up and eat that. I gave you extra and they come around and count the pieces. I don't want to get yelled at so hurry up and eat." That was definitely a first for me!  As the cooking progressed, the "Chef" was working on a pile of rice and veggies. He looked towards a pretty woman at a table who was clearly on a date and said "tell me when it's too much" and "tell me when you're getting close" as he squirted soy sauce on the rice. I don't know about you, but that's the imagery I want when someone is cooking my food in front of me. She asked for more butter (on the rice that we all share) and without asking the other 6 people at the table if they wanted an extra half stick of butter in their rice, he slaps more butter on the rice and says she can "have it just the way she likes it." Still no sign of the TV show host that is going tell me it was all a joke.   I was so uncomfortable during the whole meal, I could barely look at the chef without cringing. Not surprisingly, the bill took 25 minutes to get and it was wrong. Not once, not twice, three times. The waitress needed three attempts to properly split a check for three people (AND ALL THREE OF US GOT THE SAME MEAL.) She needed help from the manager, who seemed annoyed that he had to do some sort of work in his restaurant. I reluctantly paid for my meal only because I wanted to get the h*ll out of that place. As our group left, the manager glared at us and said nothing.  There is zero chance I will ever go there again. Seriously, only go to Yokoso if you hate yourself.

YdAgz8mrsTHWl24t7XLEhA.text: My wife and I went here for lunch on a week day. The place was very slow. The service was average. We had the hibachi. Food was average. The chef was good and entertaining. I would go back. A bit pricey.

Kx91qw4VpfC2gEVs_3wW6g.text: I'm beginning to think I'm doomed to either great meals or awful meals and ne'er anything in the middle.  Went here tonight and was shocked by how bad the service was. I've been here before and it's been fine, but, tonight was so bad we eventually asked them to box my food up instead of wait for it any longer.   The waiter was pretty much M.I.A. and never brought anything we asked for (water, chopsticks, etc.). He even brought my partner's sushi out before the salad and soup that should have come out in the 30 minutes we sat there waiting. After another 25 or so, we gave up on ever getting my (cooked) food and decided to leave.  Sadly, although we talked to a manager, he was far from helpful and just said the guy was in training. You'd think he would have helped, but he disappeared as well. I finally went in with a credit card and asked them to just box up what they had and charge me. This took another 15 minutes.  Insult to injury, the food was very disappointing.   Never again.

qGjZGwsvZwZmPmmyvwWn0g.text: Food was not as good as last time.  Lobster was a little tough.  Surprising to see another chef drink 2 "blue drinks".  I asked what it was and was told liquid marijana that their bartender makes.  I wouldn't want to be around someone twirling knives after 2 drinks.  They even had him come back out to have a 3rd.  Wild 3 couple party.

yI3X8ywj8ZDR0FcfAuZjmQ.text: So the family and I were out and about thinking to hit another spot to grab a bite to eat before we possibly catch a movie. Well since the wait at the other place was considerable we decided to walk the mall and see what could be offered. Off we went and came across a place that looked nice and offered a favorite of ours SUSHI!!!!  As we walked in on the Friday night the air hummed with a vibrant busy spot where people were getting drinks, listening to the banter and pnash of hibachi cooks doing their most awesome, and an appealing sushi bar that was begging us to try their delectable fishy treats. The hosts at the front exceeded our expectations. They were obviously busy and very much hustling but promised a possible thirty minute wait and seat us at the next available table at the sushi bar. True to their words that's exactly what they did! Refreshing considering how often you are told "it'll be thirty minutes" only to wait forty five to an hour. Then the disappointment and hilarity begins.  After being seated we grabbed menus and began formulating our plan for sushi bliss. While we were planning our awesomeness a server passed us multiple time. No welcome, no glass of water, be right with you, NOTHING. So here I sit with my family tummy grumbling waiting for that moment to get some great sushi to grub on. So we waited, waited some more, waited some more still ... did I mention we waited... then after forty five minutes of additional waiting at our table, without even a glass of water, we received a text message from the other place and left to spend our money elsewhere. As a courtesy to the manager Eugene I called back to the Yokoso to inform him of our experience. Not to be rude or complain but to just let him know so he could possibly address it and save another family the discomfort. At first he seemed appreciative and wanted us to come back in to enjoy the restaurant. He asked me to call back the following morning to arrange a time and come experience Yokoso at it's best. So in turn I obliged and called back in the morning and the afternoon with no success getting a hold of Eugene. I left my name and number and yet each time I called he was on break and would call me back. Well I'm still waiting for that call back and have avoided posting about this experience because I wanted to be fair and afford them the opportunity to follow through with what that they said they would do. I can't speak to the quality of the food in fact it looked down right delectable but the lack of service to the point NO SERVICE ruined the desire to try them out. Not to mention the fact that when management fails to live up to their word and blows you off it tells me they don't value the customers because hey there will be another one walking down the sidewalk any minute. There in lies the problem though!   So this is me telling you the potential diner stay away save yourself the potential for a frustrating experience. Just skip it and go somewhere else where they value their customers and want you to come back!

WzFJR2FyuSg2RiLePs6EUQ.text: Horrible, delayed service, overpriced for tasteless food. I'm not a person that disregards food or says its bad but sadly this place gave me a poor experience. We went because my husband loves sushi. He ordered 4 different types of sushi and said it was "decent" but nothing great. I'm not a sushi fan so I ordered the twin salmon, which is the dinner portion of their lunch teriyaki salmon. It came with japanese soup (bland), a house salad (basically from a bag of iceberg lettuce from the grocery store with some Japanese dressing), and a plate of veggies, fried rice and 2 pieces of salmon. The plate of food tasted like something out of a frozen dinner but worse. The rice was cold, no flavor, salmon was overdone, hardly any teriyaki sauce and the veggies were the only thing I could manage to eat as they weren't that bad. Very upset since that plate cost $20 and wasn't worth a penny.  Also, they had us seat ourselves and the waitress took forever to come so the lady at the front took our order.

gYBmGqAUSbgZxYlsDnu7tw.text: The food is really good, never got anything that I did not enjoy eating...I love the half off sushi Tuesday's!!

DXvRYOUnoRKDc2l5AkUwDg.text: This is my go to place for sushi! Feels like they make especially for me :) The location is great and there always seems to be parking. Service is good. Food is fab. Anything from soup, hibachi, to sushi. Half of special rolls on Tuesdays. I like the picture menus so you know exactly what you are getting, also very good for sushi newbies. Overall great place.

O01IJuE55Aop1j1UMogcyg.text: Really disappointed with the sushi. Deep fried rolls were way over fried for sushi and made roll tough to eat. I won't go back, I'll go somewhere else. Plus I think it made me sick, the seafood just tasted "old" maybe...not sure how to describe it but it turned my stomach.

photos.caption: Photo of Yokoso Japanese Steakhouse - Homestead, PA, United States. Steel city roll and yum yum roll

de4i0t6rGBsyqiuR88H6iw.text: Just ate their for the second time. Hibachi was delicious and the show was great! The chef was engaging, professional, and friendly. If noise bothers you, don't go. Great place to take kids for a celebration, as the chef kept my son entertained. Service was average, nothing special. The hostess told us it would be a 45 minute wait and took our phone number so they could text us when a table was ready. We walked around the waterfront for about 15 minutes and we got a text that our table was ready. We returned to the restaurant and the hostess (not the sharpest tool in the shed) said, "Did you get a message?" ..um, yes? Then she had us wait for another 10 minutes while they cleaned a table. Restaurant was packed at 5:30 on a Saturday. Chef said it's their busiest day of the week. I was on sensory overload the whole time, as it was super loud. Other than that, the dining experience was good, and I definitely recommend.

JBNZsiyYt-wJHEr2-s4jXA.text: I was reluctant to try this restaurant based on the previous reviews.   My friend and I are glad that we gave it a try.  We ordered sushi which was fresh and extremely good.  The hibachi meal was what you would typically expect from this type of restaurant.   They have large portions of vegetables and rice.   I especially enjoyed the hot sauce that was served with the meal.

7Q25cLhh4t3cSUTZIED5Ew.text: Depressing reception by a frowning guy. Chef takes off at 230 pm so. ..no more food. We were alone at the restaurant. Very slow plaza.

qB_turpkDVCnMVUPgYxjKw.text: I've been here only three times and each time it was on a Tuesday night for the half-off sushi. Beings that this was only the third time I've ever had sushi, I won't pretend to be a seasoned sushi expert. I know, I should get out more, but I really like the sushi here. And for ten bucks, it's a delicious treat. I only wish they had a better beer selection.

photos.caption: Photo of Yokoso Japanese Steakhouse - Homestead, PA, United States. polamalu roll
Photo of Yokoso Japanese Steakhouse - Homestead, PA, United States. TNT Roll
Photo of Yokoso Japanese Steakhouse - Homestead, PA, United States

cU5rJxzoKL17LKiWyGGVBg.text: Very fresh sushi and delicious hibachi! The best friend roll is my favorite. If you're not planning to sit at a hibachi table, go for a seat at the bar. Kristen is a blast and will take great care of you.

vV6QOc_sV0dyQ52uGM_N8w.text: When I order hibachi, I expect rice grilled on the hibachi. Not bland generic "fried" rice with corn, peas and carrots like I can get from my local delivery place. The scallops were well cooked and tasty, the shrimp also yummy, and the boyfriend had hibachi filet, which was excellent. The vegetables were not hibachi prepared either, just steamed.

1-D612SVKHkk0dAMUcAvBw.text: This was my first time here and I had a good experience. We had Holly as our waitress and she was fantastic! I had green tea and shared spicy tuna tartar with edamame. Both were tasty. I wasn't sure what to order roll-wise and asked for help. Holly suggested Polamalu roll, which I ended up getting. It was good! I noticed there was some wasabi sauce on it, but not any of the green stuff on the side to mix into my soy sauce. It wasn't a big deal for me though. Overall, the atmosphere was laid-back and we had prompt, attentive service. I would come here again.

Xdq_iCtuv_P-YalbTbe7ng.text: I'm sure there are better hibachi restaurants in Pittsburgh. It was my first time doing hibachi. It was my son's 18th birthday celebration and he wanted to come here. I didn't know what to order; so I went safe with the chicken and shrimp. The soup and salad were really good. The vegetables from my meal were really good. The shrimp was really good. The side sauces were good. The chicken, on the other hand, made we wish I had ordered more shrimp or even steak. It was over cooked. The chef sucked. While trying to entertain, he kept dropping the spatula. Then he said- who's recording? And asked me if I was and then said- that's why. I was like- um right. There was a way cooler chef (someone posted his picture on here) that even had a little kid from his table help him fry up their food. He had great tricks and was just so entertaining and fun. Left our table envious. Our chef sucked. Anyways, way too expensive for dinner and wine. But it was his birthday and I wanted to take him to a restaurant of his choice. Will not come here again; but rather venture out to different spots.

QIn-ZxlLUNPI8rRx4HHtSw.text: Still love it here! I swear the white tuna sushi and sashimi were extra good today, and who doesn't love half off specialty rolls! My favorite part was our server, Marissa, she was very attentive, nice, and polite, and laughed with us at our ridiculousness! Haha

photos.caption: Photo of Yokoso Japanese Steakhouse - Homestead, PA, United States. White tuna sushi and sashimi, can&#39;t remember the names of the rolls, sorry :/

0e1aemA8rugcCvhjTrHNww.text: Really bad service. Waited 20 minutes to take order when most tables are empty. Waitress hanging around doing nothing, and gave ugly faces when we said we were in a rush for movie. Food has nothing to do with Japanese, mostly. Never coming again.

W7b_5NxLkbIfIgn2CnUM7A.text: Let me start by saying that the the food is incredible. We did hibachi for dinner. I've done hibachi before, and this was hands down the best I've tried. The rice was mouthwatering. The shrimp was delectable. So good. We also had enough food left over to take home for 2 more meals, so it is very worth the price.  The reasons for 2 stars less are the service and atmosphere. The atmosphere seemed kind of tense - the employees, especially from the kitchen, seemed to be exhausted and overworked. I witnessed an argument between 2 employees right next to our table that seemed to be, more than anything, fueled by the exhaustion and the tense atmosphere. Also, it took about 15 minutes for the waitress to bring our drinks and food orders. She later apologized, saying that she had to close out 7 separate checks, adding to the feeling that everyone was stretched too thin. Maybe it was just a bad night, but it took a little away from the dinner.  Overall, I'd come back for the food. I'm just hoping for a nice atmosphere the next time, where the employees seem more content.

72X7h-P07TBwvzoO64U17g.text: The service is pretty subpar; we ended up walking out. All the way from Manhattan, we thought to try some nice Japanese hibachi in the neighborhood. However, we were met with apathetic staff, that did nothing to even seat us.   The front desk had five hostess/waitress members who did nothing but stare off into space. When asked multiple times how long it will take to get a seat ready, they replied "just 1 more minute".   The place wasn't terribly busy, and folks who came after us were even seated before us (though their numbers were less; we were a party of three).  When we let them know we were leaving, they still looked as if they were dazed and out of it.  Thanks for nothing and wasting about 10-15 minutes of our time, folks!

aiyRSavR_d3jPLgzAFFwTg.text: Yuck! Went here for lunch and ordered from the hibachi lunch menu and sushi. Idk how or why this place exists. Ordered chicken and shrimps. First of all I got chicken scraps.. dried scraps, and the shrimp was nasty transparent soggy shrimp def from the freezer. They don't give you very much at all esp for the price you pay. They just give you a ton of salty fried rice to deceive you into thinking you're getting your money's worth. Sushi is gross too, imagine eating day old shrimp tempura.. stale chewy panko bread crumbs, no thanks. And they drizzle everything with that wasabi cream sauce to mask the taste of nasty.   Sorry Yokoso, or Yuck-ko-so

7tsMMPMAz5mBZcUnFp8ZvA.text: Poor service and not that clean. My wife and I stopped in at about a 9:45 PM on a Friday night. It readily became apparent that the staff was more interested in preparing to close for the evening than it was in serving customers still coming in. Our waitress was pretty much MIA. We had a flag down other waitresses to get our waitress when we needed something. It took quite a bit of time to get our meal and when we got it the vegetables were cold. The food wasn't bad but this is definitely a case of poor service killing the meal.   The amount of food that was on the floor under our booth was pretty gross. There was rice, broccoli and at least one piece of shrimp on the ground directly underneath of our table. I also had to wipe down my seat before sitting down because of all the rice that was left there. Apparently on top of being too busy to give halfway decent service they were also too busy to make the restaurant halfway presentable. When leaving our waitress didn't even bother to ask how our meal was and it was obvious she didn't care. I definitely won't go back and I left there feeling like the place was kind of ghetto.

h9XFDWagrXiWEGmYIZegwQ.text: Consistently good selection and fresh fish with a generous side of mediocre service.  Nice bar list including Sapporo on tap, spoiled by waiting at the bar to pay the check with the bar left fully unattended on Saturday night for 10-15 minutes.  They had alot of fun local house rolls like a Pitt Panther Roll, Steel City Roll, 3 Rivers, Crosby Roll, Polamalu Roll, and Pirate Roll.  When I asked the waiter what their favorite specialty house roll was they recommended the "California Roll".  Whoah, slow down wild man!  I don't know if my tastes are that adventurous!  We ordered the Sashimi Platter and Spicy Tuna Tartare which were very fresh and well done when they arrived.  There was a long wait and they initially forgot the Tuna.  If the service was as good as the sushi I'd give it 5 stars, but as it is, you'll come for the food, and leave for the service.

LvDdJ_wAHaog7-s5V6b33w.text: I have been to many sushi restaurants, cheap to fancy. But at Yokoso, sushi is definitely not their strong point. The sushi pieces were mouthfuls of mostly rice, that too little dry . I ordered a Rainbow Roll and The Pitt Roll. Not good. The prices are OK not very reasonable. I dont know about the other items on the menu, but sushi was meh! Only go here if you are absolutely craving for one. But the service was good and prompt.

hDsx4LCmfWxePdlJlkd9_w.text: Everything seemed OK until hair was discovered in my fried rice. The manager (late 20s black male, short hair) offered to recook the rice. I declined because my appetite was already negated, and I asked him how did I know that it wouldn't happen again? He had no answer other than that he would remove it from the check (which he did). Perhaps if he spent less time outside smoking (he reeked of cigarette smoke when he came to the table) or watching the steelers game and more time watching the cooks/waitstaff, this might have been avoided. There's another review on here from another person that found hair in their food. We DEFINITELY won't be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Yokoso Japanese Steakhouse - Homestead, PA, United States. Hair fried rice. Look closely in the center. Seems like this is a recurring issue here.

oULX7IjjCIsqe07P_UpWlQ.text: I feel like every habachi place is very similar and Yokosa didnt disappoint in this regard.  Service was fine, habachi was what you expect.  The only part of the meal that was extraordinary was the volcano rolls that we had were truly fantastic.  Good location in the waterfront.  Like any habachi place, come with a group and you'll have a much better time than date night.  We had a group of 10 for my moms birthday and had a blast.

64FbsRvvWRo4zVZJAtidgw.text: Yeah, it's not the best sushi in the world, but the price is right.  I had the Teriyaki Chicken, salad, California Roll, and Diet Coke all for under 20 bucks, plus had leftovers for lunch the next day.  Our server was very attentive, esp with keeping my Diet Coke always full.  Numerous other staff stopped by our table throughout our time there; not sure if the staff was mgmt. as they did not identify themselves.  So many stopped by during our meal that it was comical....not sure if that is the standard or Yokoso was overstaffed that day and the employees were looking for something to do :)  There aren't a tremendous amount of fine dining options at the Waterfront, and most of the restaurants are national chains .  I don't *think* Yokoso is a chain after a Google search, but I'm not positive.  You could def do worse at the Waterfront - overall, a pleasant experience at a reasonable price point.

5QRb8qO22A6ks0AqIJU-VQ.text: Went here with coworkers. The sushi was pretty good. It's in a great area with lots to do, so that is always nice! The service was decent, nothing amazing though. We sat at the bar area, so maybe that's why. I'll go back, or maybe order take out next time.

kPhoOTtQaBFrzKwg8u7_Tg.text: I was on a business trip recently and 18 of us went to Yokoso.  I eat at Japanese Steakhouses regularly so it was not a new or special experience.  We had two chefs (we had two tables next to each other in their own alcove.  All of our party had a great time, the chefs were very good and funny and the portions were properly cooked and very generous.  The wait staff was also very good.  The restaurant itself was clean, nice and properly lit.  Could not ask for anything more.
